description:
A perfect location with public transportation right at your door leading you straight to the heart of Downtown Ottawa or a 15 minute drive by car.

The space
It's a very cozy one bedroom, one bath apartment in a brand new building with wood and tiles throughout the living space and bathroom. The apartment is fully equipped with all the essentials you need in your kitchen, bathroom and bedroom. The bedroom has a queen size bed with plenty of closet space and the living space has a couch with a large TV which you can stream with the Netflix service. An air mattress can be provided in the common space if required. The building is brand new and quiet, it’s easily accessible to the OC Transpo (94 Bus) which will bring you directly downtown (25 minutes) and to the East/West end of the city directly. There is parking on site which is included. The apartment get cleaned by professional services after each guest leaves.

description:
This flat is on the second floor of six unit walk up, its perfect for visitors who want to be able to walk to where ever they need to get to. Whether its for business or pleasure it has everything one needs for short or long term stays. It does have extra space if you have more then one couple. You will find it listed in our Three bedroom, Home away from Home. We would like to offer the option of just renting the main floor for clients that don't need all the extra space.

The space
Thank you for looking us up. My cosy get away is walking distance to the Ottawa market, Rideau centre, boutiques, pubs & restaurants. Parliament hill, Rideau canal, museums and so much more. If your visiting any of the hospitals, General, Civic, or Montfort they are a max., 10 min., drive. The Bruyere hospital is a 5 min., walk.
The University of Ottawa is also a 15 min., walk. Easy access to highways & buses.
Warm & cosy second floor flat has a semi private entrance

neighborhood_overview:
The Byward Market district of Ottawa is the heart of the entire city. It is situated between the historical sites of the country of Canada, such as the Parliament buildings, and the middle of downtown Ottawa where events happen often. There are countless places to eat, explore and shop at.

Places nearby include the Rideau Mall, the Byward Market, Blue Cactus Bar and Grill, National Gallery of Canada, the Parliament of Canada, Shoppers and many more.

Walking distance to all the above and Major Mall's,Park and the Ottawa River.

description:

Our house is located on a quiet dead-end street. Orchard Hollow Park is at the end of the street, right along the Rideau River.

This is the perfect property for anything from a weekend getaway to family outings.

The space
Approximately 2700 sq ft of living space (including the fully finished basement) with a light-filled sun-room and wrap-around porch.

Family area, dinning room and kitchen are located on main floor. A 55 inch smart LED TV is setup in family area. Network cable is provided if a guest wants a wired network connection!

Master bedroom has a queen size bed and an ensuite bathroom with disability access.

description:
This location offers ground floor accommodation in a lovely and well-maintained home on quiet Vachon Avenue. Two blocks from Beechwood Village, you will be walking distance to an upscale and vibrant community. Lovingly renovated, this bright suite feels like an upscale condo, with modern furnishings and tons of function. A shared yard is available for barbecues or bicycle storage. Brushing the east side of Ottawa, this location puts you within 15 minutes of where you want to go around the city.

The space
This contemporary suite includes: fully outfitted with stylish furnishings, separate large eat-in designer kitchen, comfortable Queen-size bed, Queen size pull-out couch, linens, blankets and towels, desk, telephone, secure high speed wifi, flat screen TV with cable package, DVD Player, mini stereo with iPod dock, alarm clock with radio, laundry in suite, iron and ironing board, blow dryer, Coded front door lock, gas fireplace, air conditioning. Parking for 1 car
neighborhood_overview: Bordering New Edinburgh and Rockcliffe Park, Beechwood Village is a charming neighborhood with many national landmarks. From the grounds of the Governor General's residence at Rideau Hall, to beautiful Beechwood Cemetery there is a wide choice of places to visit on bike or on foot. The peaceful paths of the Ottawa river are nearby and the vibrant Byward Market is only a short ride over the St. Patrick Street bridge. Village Suites is walking distance to the shops of Beechwood Avenue where good coffee, fresh flowers, warm bread or a bus stop are at your fingertips.

description:
Central location!

3 Full Bedrooms. Luxurious, Clean, and Spacious! The perfect home away from home with all the hotel comforts and more! Minutes away from Downtown, Byward Market, Rideau Shopping Center, Rideau Canal, and Parliament Hill! No better place to discover Ottawa.

Parking Options available!

In addition to all the essentials, this location is also equipped with:
- SmartTV (Netflix, YouTube... )
- Unlimited High Speed Internet
- Full Kitchen
- Washer/Dryer
- New AC setup for each room as of June 2019

Safe and happy travels!

The space
This unit has three separate bedrooms for two couples or parents with children. A wonderful living room area which offers a Smart TV that allows Netflix and YouTube to be accessed. Additionally, a modern kitchen with Granite Countertops, Stainless Steel Fridge/Stove, Washer/Dryer, a fully renovated bathroom as well as access to a balcony!

Gues
neighborhood_overview:
THIS is where you want to be! Right on the bustling Rideau Street and near everything Ottawa has to offer! It doesn't get any better than this.

Museums, museums, and more museums. This location has over a dozen museums in proximity (nature, war, postal, history, science & technology, agriculture, civilization, etc.)

Or, spend the day relaxing in the largest thermal spa in North America; Nordik Spa-Nature, situated only 10 minutes way.

Perhaps you'd like to try your luck against the one-armed-bandits? You are a short 15 minutes drive to the "Lac-Lemay" Casino in Hull!

Then, finish off by watching the sunset on a hilltop in the Gatineau Park.

These are just a few suggestions of activities to do during your time here. Once you book your stay with us, be sure to check out the Guestbook for more details and other "MUST-DO" items in Ottawa.

description:
My house is not central but conveniently close to public transport and the highway to downtown (15 minutes) - a great starting point to explore Ottawa! The airport is 10 minutes away. You’ll love my place because of the open concept layout (lots of light), the swimming pool (salt system), the hot tub, the comfy beds, the European flair... and Spencer the Cat! Great for families, friends, or groups of business travellers.

The space
The master bedroom has a queen-size bed with luxury mattress topper, cotton linens and hypo-allergenic duvets. It has an ensuite bathroom, and boasts its own Napoleon gas stove. The other bedrooms have a double bed and are adjacent to a full bathroom . The kitchen is fully equipped (including a Nestle Dolce Gusto espresso machine). The pool and the landscaped backyard may be a seasonal treat, but the hot tub is functional year-round, and conveniently located just off the kitchen patio door. There is a lovely gas fireplace in the living
neighborhood_overview:
My neighbourhood is quiet, residential, family-oriented, and culturally diverse. There are many parks, playgrounds, and recreational trails just a few steps away. A major shopping mall (South Keys) - with grocery store, bank, electronics store and several food outlets and chain stores (such as Winners, Homesense, Wal-mart, The Source) is 2.5 km away.There are several gas stations around, as well as a little strip mall with a convenience store and a pharmacy within 1 km.
If you are looking for a restaurant, KS (Daze Street) is a great family restaurant with excellent food (try their pizzas!) and two patios across the road from the South Keys shopping mall.

description:
1,900 square foot Santa Fe style bungalow with modern kitchen, hallway and bathroom sky-lights. This traditional Southwestern architecture designed house has three bedrooms and one pull out couch and is done in Venetian plaster throughout. Arched entrance ways into the dining room area and curved corners complete the design. There is a huge 40' x 20' foot pool in a treed private backyard that includes a BBQ. An 8 person sauna is available to you in the basement - all on a quiet treed street.

The space
Southwestern house plans reflect a rich history of Colonial Spanish and Native American styles and are usually one story with flat roofs, covered porches, and round log ceiling beams.

Walls of Southwestern style homes like The CasaGrotto are often stucco or stone and have overhangs or trellises to provide shade from the desert sun. Southwestern house plans tend to be asymmetrical with alcoves, spacious living areas, and fluid layouts.

Gue
neighborhood_overview:
Beaverbrook is bounded by March Road to the north and east, Campeau Drive to the south, and just to the west of Carr, Pentland, Tiffany and Reaney Crescents. Beaverbrook is one of the original neighbourhoods of the former city of Kanata.

The area remained mainly agricultural until the 1960s, when it was developed from rural land that was acquired by Bill Teron. The neighbourhood was built using a model community approach, which made Beaverbrook into an independent neighbourhood that has its own unique character and commercial services.

Other things to note
There is plenty of choice in restaurants and cafes nearby for all budgets. If you are eating in, you will find grocery stores at the top of the street, including the Hintonburg Marché providing deli meat & cheese, local produce and healthy take out prepared meals; Bread by Us for fresh baked bread & pastries. The LCBO down the street provides wine, beer and spirits.
neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a unique arty neighbourhood just west of downtown. It is a 5-10 minute taxi from the bus station, 10-15 minute taxi from the train station and about a 25 minute taxi from the airport. You can easily access public transportation to downtown and be in the heart of the market within 5-10 minutes. The closest bus stop is the Tunney's pasture Station.
There are lots of trendy cafes, restaurants and shops in the neighborhood. the Apartment is just a few minutes walk to parks, the Ottawa river, yoga studios, micro breweries, restaurants, bars, fresh pressed-juice bars and other cool hang-out spots. This area is more quiet than downtown, and only a 5-10 minute bus ride or taxi away from downtown core.
Hintonburg is a safe and friendly neighborhood – and the trendiest place in town. You could enjoy an action- packed vacation and never leave the neighborhood

description:
Gone are the days of Grandma’s house, this Modern Farmhouse is a cozy 2 bedroom apartment where rustic meets industrial. Nestled in the back of this heritage home, county elements of board and batten, stained glass, warm wood and brick are off-set with modern matte black painted doors and cabinetry and copper accents. This farmhouse styled apartment incorporates the old and the new, the timeless and the modern. It’s sophisticated, yet simple. And it invites you to kick back and relax in comfort

The space
This is our second renovation on a 1890’s heritage home located in Centretown. We wanted to create a unique guest experience, each apartment was designed with a different theme in mind. Again, each of our 3 apartments are furnished with local artist’s work, including Julian Garner (5ivecents), locally found antiques as well as many handmade items.

Guest access
Guests will have complete access to their own unique apartment.

Ot

Welcoming guests of 28 days or more: One of the very few century homes to undergo a complete renovation. There is 2800 sq ft of living area and an attached garage. Guests will find a well stocked kitchen and ample space for relaxing and entertaining. We have removed our personal possessions to allow guests to enjoy the space as their own.

We have been featured in the Ottawa At Home magazine and been a tour home in the Glebe Home Show.

The space
The house includes design touches from our time living overseas in Asia. There is a 'wet room' in the Master Ensuite that contains a soaker tub and two shower heads. The hallways all have built-in wall lighting which creates a beautiful calming atmosphere.
The house has three bedrooms: master with a king bed, en-suite, walk-in closet and den with fireplace. Second bedroom with king bed (cozy bed of two singles and a king mattress topper) and third bedroom with king bed.
The open-concept
neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of an established centuries old area called the Glebe, a very hip and urban suburb that really has all you need for entertainment & shopping. Lined by beautiful Victorian style homes with “Ma and Pa” shops from boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs.
You are a five minute walk to the scenic Rideau canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.
Parliament Hill is close enough to walk but easy public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) will have you there in ten minutes.
The Lansdowne development has brought a new vibe with trendy nightclubs and restaurants, green space with skatepark and play structures, a Whole Foods grocery store and a modern theatre build around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), the Ottawa Fury (ASL) and the Ott

neighborhood_overview:
If you’re looking to live in the heart of downtown Ottawa, Centretown is the place to be. Centretown is a leafy residential district with a busy commercial core of clothes stores, brunch spots and lively Irish pubs on Elgin and Bank streets. The Rideau Canal is popular for its waterside trail and becomes an ice-skating rink in winter, while Dundonald and Jack Purcell parks are dotted with monuments and public artwork. The Canadian Museum of Nature has exhibits on Arctic fossils and polar bears.

Centretown’s history is naturally intertwined with the history of Ottawa, and you can see that history anywhere you look. Just north of the “official” boundaries of Centretown are the Parliament Buildings of Canada, the famous Chateau Laurier, the former Ottawa central train station, and historic Sparks St. West of Elgin, you’ll find many of the bank and financial towers that keep the city’s economy moving forward.

neighborhood_overview:
The ByWard Market is where Ottawa was born. Established by Lt-Col. John By in 1826, the ByWard Market is one of Canada’s oldest public markets. The legendary builder of the Rideau Canal; Lt-Col By laid out the street plan of the Market by himself, designating George and York Streets to be extra wide to accommodate the horse-drawn carriages that brought foodstuffs to the market every day.

Today, the ByWard Market is Ottawa’s number one tourist attraction, and is the premier destination for shopping, dining, arts, entertainment and professional services for residents and visitors.

This area averages 50,000 visitors per weekend in the summer months.
It is home to both a local farmers' market and artisans with over 260 stands, as well as over 500 businesses. In 2014, the ByWard Market will play host to 6.3 million of the 7 million visitors expected to visit the Nation’s Capital in 2014.

neighborhood_overview: My heritage home is centrally located with direct access to various bus routes which will get you to downtown Ottawa within 10 minutes. A 10 minute walk or bike ride will take you to the NCC Scenic Driveway which meanders through the Central Experimental Farm, the Canada Agriculture and Food Museum, the Dominium Arboretum, and the Fletcher Wildlife Garden. Once here you can walk or bike along the 8 km pathways along Ottawa's beautiful Rideau Canal. Rent a canoe, paddleboard or paddle boat and enjoy the view from the water. You eventually end up in downtown Ottawa and could spend the rest of your day exploring our Byward Market where you can discover the many restaurants, shops and shopping centers available to you.

Non-smoking building.

description:
Welcome to the Greenberg Flat. We have created this space for the urban dweller who appreciates simple and clean lines. And although we did not collaborate with Herman Miller on furniture pieces, we found the next best Ottawa designer at Wiseman & Cromwell who helped us pick unique pieces to go with that “Mid Century Modern” phrase everyone keeps using. We hope you enjoy your stay with us at The Art House Airbnb.

The space
We purchased this 1890's victorian mansion with a dream to restore and renovate the property into 3 charming and distinct apartments. We wanted to create a unique guest experience, each apartment was designed with a different theme in mind. All our of units are adorned with works from local artists all available for purchase.

description:
Large 1 bedroom apartment with comfortable queen bed. Nestled between award winning cafes and restaurants, yoga studio, and close to the parliament of Canada, downtown , little Italy , recently renovated, new appliances. Located in the popular hintonburg neighbourhood. Close to highway and bus routes. No pets or smoking allowed.

The space
Clean and Cozy space, with complete private access to Apartment .

Guest access
The entire apartment is yours for your stay and not shared with the host. Parking available for 1 car.

Other things to note
There is plenty of choice in restaurants and cafes nearby for all budgets. If you are eating in, you will find grocery stores at the top of the street, including the Hintonburg Marché providing deli meat & cheese, local produce and healthy take out prepared meals; Bread by Us for fresh baked bread & pastries. The LCBO down the street provides wine, beer and spirits.
neighborhood_overview: Hintonburg is a unique arty neighbourhood just west of downtown. It is a 5-10 minute taxi from the bus station, 10-15 minute taxi from the train station and about a 25 minute taxi from the airport. You can easily access public transportation to downtown and be in the heart of the market within 5-10 minutes. The closest bus stop is the Tunney's pasture Station. There are lots of trendy cafes, restaurants and shops in the neighborhood. the Apartment is just a few minutes walk to parks, the Ottawa river, yoga studios, micro breweries, restaurants, bars, fresh pressed-juice bars and other cool hang-out spots. This area is more quiet than downtown, and only a 5-10 minute bus ride or taxi away from downtown core. Hintonburg is a safe and friendly neighborhood – and the trendiest place in town. You could enjoy an action- packed vacation and never leave the neighborhood

description:
Our home is located in beautiful Elmvale Acres, a mere 2 kilometres from The Ottawa Hospital and only 8 kilometres from Parliament. This 3-bedroom, 1960's bungalow has nostalgic charm with a modern finish. Located in a quiet neighbourhood close to all the amenities, our home is a lovely spot to stay if you're in town to see the sights or catch some R&R.

The space
The front half of the house contains a fully equipped kitchen and dining area for preparing meals together at home, and a large sunny living room where all can relax.

The rear of the house has a 4-piece bath and three bedrooms: the master bedroom with a king bed, corner room with a queen, and hall room with two singles. For more sleep space the sofa in the living room pulls-out to a double bed.

Our bright, cozy home is ideally located for those working at the hospital and is perfectly spacious for families or small groups just visiting town.

Dur
neighborhood_overview:
Adams Avenue is very much a family block – chances are you’ll see our neighbours or their kids out and about in the street. We ask that you do be respectful of the home and area – please drive carefully and be conscientious about noise.

The Adams Family Residence situated in central Elmvale Acres - you can find everything you need within two kilometers of our door! Only 500 meters from home are Three Sisters Bake Shop, Lorenzo's neighbourhood bar, and Shawarma Rosana. At Elmvale Acres Shopping Centre (1.8 km) you'll find groceries, the liquor & beer stores, and several dining options.

neighborhood_overview: My neighborhood is Hintonburg!  Arty Hintonburg's shopping and dining scene is centered on the cool boutiques, bistros, local grocery store, summer market, cafes and coffee shops of Wellington Street West.  At night, locals head to trendy supper clubs and micro brewpubs. The Great Canadian Theatre Company stages edgy work by local playwrights, while small galleries, studios and street murals reflect the creative atmosphere.  There is plenty to see here!

neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of an established centuries old area called the Glebe, a very hip and urban neighborhood that really has all you need for entertainment & shopping. Lined by beautiful Victorian style homes with “Ma and Pa” shops from boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs.
You are a five minute walk to the scenic Rideau canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.
Parliament Hill is close enough to walk but easy public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) will have you there in ten minutes.
The Lansdowne development has brought a new vibe with trendy nightclubs and restaurants, green space with skatepark and play structures, a Whole Foods grocery store and a modern theatre build around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), the Ottawa Fury (ASL) and t

description:
My place is close to downtown, Wellington West Village, Hintonburg, Westboro, the Ottawa River, Gatineau Park, public transit, cycling/jogging paths, parks, theatre, shops, yoga, and tons of amazing local restaurants, cafés & bakeries. You’ll love my place because of the neighborhood, comfy bed, newly-renovated & fully equipped kitchen, ample parking, inviting living space, front porch, and back patio, yard & garden. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers & families.

The space
This is a charming century home filled with character and love. You'll find hardwood throughout this bright and sunny house. There's lots of room to spread out, with very large separate dining and living rooms, an office, newly-renovated and fully-equipped kitchen, spacious bedroom, private 4-piece bathroom, and more! You have complete access to a large front and back yard, front porch, back patio (with table and BBQ), large grass area, beautiful garden, spacious
neighborhood_overview: Located on a quiet residential street, only a few houses away from Wellington Street West, right in the heart of Wellington West Village, one of the city's most charming neighbourhoods. It's a true village, with a classic main street just steps away (literally a 1 minute walk). Walk to all the amenities you could ask for in 1-5 minutes, including several grocery stores, pharmacies, and bike shops, countless cafés & bakeries, a wide variety of excellent restaurants (fine dining, casual, and fast food), many great bars, 2 liquor stores, and a beer store. You'll find gems like the specialty Italian deli/grocer, our neighbourhood hardware store, an ice cream shop, a gelato bar, and more. Cleaners, laundromats, yoga studios, juice bars, health food stores, record shops, kitchen stores, and plenty of shops to peruse are on offer.

neighborhood_overview:

The location is perfect for strolling Wellington Village and Hintonburg. Less than 5 km to Parliament Hill and Byward Market.

Highlighted by The Boston Globe as being a very "cool 'hood" to visit. Named a top-ten neighbourhood nationwide by enRoute magazine. neighborhood_overview:
We absolutely love Old Ottawa South. There are plenty of conveniences nearby, yet our backyard is very quiet. The residents are a mix of Carleton students, young families, and community-minded retired couples.

A quick stroll brings you to the canal and its beautiful pathways and parks to explore. Two options for movie theatres are within walking distance - a Cineplex at Lansdowne and a nifty independent theatre called the Mayfair. Restaurant options abound, with standard options like Milestones at Lansdowne and independent pubs just down the street. Speaking of Lansdowne, you will be a stones-throw from a football game, hockey game, concert, full-moon yoga, Sunday morning market, or any of the other wonderful events.

description:
Welcome to our lovely renovated heritage home located in the quiet residential area of the Byward Market, walking distance to outdoor vendors, museums, the Rideau Canal and the Parliament Buildings.

Private room with a double bed in a renovated heritage home in the ByWard Market area. Enjoy a home-stay environment, well located to universities, attractions and services. Long term guests enjoy all meals included -- perfect for students.

Walk to uOttawa, easy access to Carleton, UQO, UNAM.

The space
Our family home is inviting and without guests mostly empty! Well located in the heart of Ottawa's historic Market district, we are a short walk from many sights and services. Your private bedroom and access to two shared bathrooms will feel very much like 'living at home' and it's that sort of homestay atmosphere we enjoy.
Dine with us, watch TV with us, or retire to your bedroom for privacy. Our long stay guests have become very much 'par
neighborhood_overview: The Byward Market area is Ottawa's oldest neighbourhood -- before we were called Ottawa, we were known as 'Bytown' and our home was built in the 1850s when this city was a small lumber town.  Today our neighbourhood retains the architecture and scale of the old city, but has become the restaurant and bar district.  A few short blocks from us, the streets are lined with services and patios, some open 24 hours a day.  Proximity to the University, and easy access to tourist sites make this the perfect location for someone planning a term at school but looking to visit the city too!

description:
Inviting, spacious two bedroom apartment in an established, leafy, central neighbourhood. Brand new kitchen! Walk to shops and restaurants and Grey Cup Stadium. We are located between the Rideau Canal and the Rideau River. Stroll along the canal...we are close to downtown Ottawa, the Byward Market and Glebe/Lansdowne. Connect to the bike network all the way to Gatineau Park.
We are world travelers ourselves and welcome the opportunity to share our beautiful city with you!

The space
This roomy apartment has it's own entrance, high ceilings, large sunny windows, radiant heat floors, fresh new fully equipped kitchen with gas range and a bathroom with shower.
The two large bedrooms have desks to accommodate the business traveler. Your hosts live on the upper level and are music lovers (that said the home has excellent sound insulation because of the poured concrete radiant heat floors above).
The apartment is suitable for a couple who need extra spa

description:
Indulge in our turnkey studio in central Ottawa!

Featuring a generous living area, galley eat-in kitchen, spacious bathroom, private outdoor patio, and shared outdoor terrace with natural gas BBQs. We’ve taken care of essentially all your needs!

The space
The studio is approximately 600 square feet. It features a large sleeping and living area, galley kitchen, generous bathroom with full tub, laundry room with staking washer and dryer, and a front entranceway with generous closets throughout.

The studio comes full furnished, with high speed internet, air conditioning, a staking washer and drier, luxurious towels and linens, Keurig coffee maker, high end flatware, stemware, and crockery, a Nest thermostat to keep you confortable, and more!

In addition to the interior space, there is a private patio attached with a bistro table for eating outside. Beautiful, matching linens are provided along with luxurious towels.

What
neighborhood_overview:
Centretown Ottawa is unquestionably the place to be in Ottawa. It is a vibrant, multicultural neighbourhood in the centre of the city, with easy access to Parliament, Byward Market, uOttawa, and most downtown government buildings.

The neighbourhood has a plenthora of cool, quirky coffee shops, tantalizing restaurants, especially along Bank street, and is close to the sights and sounds of Little Italy and China Town.

neighborhood_overview: Old Ottawa East is a beautiful and vibrant community. Just around the corner, left on Main Street you can find the famous Green Door vegetarian restaurant, Watson's pharmacy, Three Trees gift shop, The Singing Pebble book store, Café Qui Pense as well as St. Paul's University. Turn right (then left on Hawthorne)  to make your way to Old Town Hall Community Centre, the beautiful canal, Beans and Greens restaurant, The Happy Goat Cafe, Little Italy Fine Foods, Greek on Wheels, Cyco's bike and skate rental, a grocery and LCBO (wine, beer, spirits) store.

The space
In the heart of Lowertown, you will be steps away from most downtown Ottawa attractions. It is a great place to come celebrate Canada's 150th. From the rooftop patio you will be able to enjoy the hustle and bustle of the city.

Close to all attractions, including Parliament building and museums, and also major embassies.

My husband and I live in the building and it is our pleasure to help you enjoy your stay in Ottawa and to make the most out of your time.

neighborhood_overview:
walking distance to Ottawa's attractions including Byward Market that is home to both a local farmers' market and artisans with over 260 stands, as well as over 500 businesses, including:
108 restaurants, including 2 - 24 hour restaurants (Zak’s and Dunn’s),
23 Nightlife and Entertainment Venues – including: The Chateau Lafayette – Ottawa’s oldest tavern, established in 1849, and the home to the ‘Lucky Ron Show’,
25 Arts, Culture and Education Facilities – and home to: The National Gallery of Canada
Notre Dame Basilica – Ottawa’s oldest and largest church – opened in 1885,
11 Books and News Shops
57 Fashion Shops -Home of designer Richard Robinson’s shop and haute couture school
18 House and Home Shops
19 Boutiques
39 Health and Beauty Salons

Ottawa's main attractions within walking distance:
Parliament Hill: 10 minutes
Rideau Canal: 15 minutes
Watson's Mill: 9 minutes
Ottawa Rowing Club: 12 minutes

Lovely Fully Furn.'d Bedrm within a 3 bedroom stunningly renovated Apt. in Brick Triplex/5 min walk to Ottawa U., 10 min. walk to Downtown, 5 min. to Cordon Bleu Culin. School
Safe, Modern, Charming, lovely backyard, No Partying

These are shared fully furnished 3 bedroom apartments, well maintained and cared for. They offer a peaceful retreat and accommodate an existing base of Ottawa Univ. mature students and professors or tenants with contractual summer jobs with the government. Please note that price quoted is for one Guest per Bedroom within a fully furnished shared 3 bedroom apartment.

Also, students attending culinary courses at "The Cordon Bleu", a 5 min. walk away, have thoroughly enjoyed our well equipped kitchens with granite countertops.

This is a working small ecological vegetable farm. Immerse yourself in the lifestyle. If you're really keen, you can lend us a hand in the farmwork and learn a thing or two!

We can even share a delicious meal made with quality local ingredients.

Go for a ski / snowshoe / walk in forest trails right out the door!

Hang out with us and ask us anything you want. We're a very open and friendly bunch :-)

The space
This is a 112-acre farm, close to the city. It's peaceful because it's surrounded by quiet forest with XC ski / snowshoe / walking trails, and we're a 3 min walk from the majestic Ottawa river.

Inside the house, the best spot is definitely hanging out by the wood stove in the kitchen.

Guest access
You can explore pretty much anywhere you want!

description:
This three bedroom single detached house built in old Kanata on a large lot, now part of the city of Ottawa, is just minutes from the Canadian Tire Centre and high-tech companies as well as the Carling Campus of the National Defence Headquarters and Westley Clover Equestrian Park and 1/2 hour drive to downtown Ottawa. House is 1800 square feet, with two stories. The large lot is completely fenced in, also with a hedge for complete privacy. Please no smoking in my home.

This is our family home, and we're out of town! We hope you enjoy your stay.

1 master bedroom w/King size bed, 1 kids' bed
neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is one of Ottawa's oldest neighborhoods, with lots of character. It has recently become Ottawa's most hip and trendy neighborhood. People come from all over Ottawa for its restaurants, cafes, donuts, ice cream, farmer's markets, and great shopping.

You are close to all the festivals that occur in the summer: Bluesfest, Jazz fest, Arboretum, Westfest, etc.

There are many parks and playgrounds including wading pools and splashpads.

neighborhood_overview:
You will be in Lowertown, Ottawa's oldest neighbourhood, which also includes the ByWard Market. The "Urban Renewal" project has eroded Lowertown's heritage, but Clarence Street (formerly Franklin) and York Street east of King Edward have largely preserved their heritage. Among our block houses, the only house that has kept its stables (as horses were the main means of transport) is the red brick house with a triangular roof just east of King Edward. The houses in the neighbourhood generally date from the late 1890s, when Ottawa was a timber processing and logging city.

Clarence Street begins with the American Embassy in the west (at the market) and continues to the Rideau River in the east. Clarence intersects King Edward Boulevard, formerly a boulevard with trees and benches in the middle of its peninsula. Unlike the pre-urban era of urban renewal when Clarence / Franklin was a busy street, this is no longer the case outside the market area. East of King Edward, Clarence w

description:
We offer a quiet and respectful private bedroom with en-suite bathroom (with a shower). The space is small but very cozy. The unit is on the main floor, it is independent from all other units and is accessed through a common foyer. Our beautiful three story Historic Center Town Home is home to your hosts Rick and Rob, and their pooch Nuk, along with three sets of long term tenants in their rental units located in the basement, second floor and third floor of the house.

The space
We have a 115 year old historic home with original wood detailing, hand-painted chandelier and gorgeous stained glass windows. Heat for the home is hot water rads plus electric heat that you control for the winter and a window air conditioner for the summers. Sheets, pillows and towels are hotel grade for your comfort. Although there is no sitting area in your room, which fits a queen size bed, you have full access to the beautifully decorated front porch lounge area. Enjoy sitting
neighborhood_overview: The location provides easy access to/from The Queensway (Hwy 417) with many restaurants, coffee shops, bars, food stores and liquor stores as close as one block away on Elgin and Bank Streets. Take a stroll along the gorgeous Rideau Canal that flows into the Ottawa River or head to Parliament Hill, all within a 15 minute walk. Follow the Canal for 20 minutes and you are ready to explore the vibrant By-ward Market and the huge Rideau Shopping Centre . Center Town is ground zero for the Capital.  Everything central is within walking distance or 10 $ cab.  LCBO is on the same block, Bars and restaurants start within 200 metres.

description:
Bright, quiet, clean & comfortable room in elegant, pet-free, detached home. King-size bed with luxurious bedding, ample closet/drawer space & lighting, desk, Keurig coffee. Private bathroom nearby. Full access to kitchen/dining areas, living rooms & garden. Parking, toiletries, Netflix, air con, Wi-Fi.
Walk to shops, parks, restos, multiplex cinema, public transit, Canadian Tire Centre & Sensplex. Ten mins.' drive to Kanata tech hub & Tanger Outlet mall, 25 mins. to downtown.

The space
--THE BEDROOM: It's located on the second storey, at the opposite end of a long hall from the master bedroom occupied by the host, so lots of privacy!
The sunny, large & quiet bedroom is tastefully decorated. The king-sized bed is super comfortable with soft, high thread-count cotton bedding, memory foam mattress topper and huge feather-filled duvet and pillows. You'll appreciate the good lighting for reading and working, the sizeable, leather-topped desk, coffee/tea
neighborhood_overview: THE NEIGHBOURHOOD: My house is a short walk to the Signature shopping Centre and Centrum shopping Centre, with varied stores and supermarkets, coffee shops, restaurants, banks, multi-screen cinema and services. Insmill Park is right across the street from my house, and the area abounds in walking, cycling, snowshoeing and x-country ski trails. Walk to the Sensplex and Canadian Tire Centre for concerts and sporting events. The drive to the Kanata high-tech hub and Tanger Outlet mall is about 10 minutes, Highway 417 (Queensway) is 5 minutes and downtown is about 25 minutes' drive. All in all, an ideal location!

description:
We live in a quite neighborhood just 4km to the city centre if you are looking for restaurants, museums and night life. If you would like to venture into nature, the river bike path is about 1km away. The trails are long and beautiful. On Sundays in the summer from 9:00am-1:00pm the city closes down our parkways for cars. This allows cyclist, runners and rollerbladers to travel for miles without traffic. If you like hiking, the Gatineau hills are about 20kms.

The space
We are new at this but love our home. My sister has lived in this apartment for several years and found it to be very cozy and comfortable. Included is wifi and cable TV. If there is anything that is not listed that you are in need of, please do not hesitate to contact us and we will be happy to try and accommodate. The space
The apartment is in a quiet building on the main floor so excellent for persons with disabilities. It accommodates 4 persons comfortably with Queen bed and Queen sofa bed. Kitchen is fully equipped, and contains a dinette for two persons.

Canada day weekend (3 nights)

Tulip festival in May

neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is also very quiet yet in a vibrant part of the city where you can find banks, ATM, bixie bikes, car rentals etc. Please note, Uber or Taxi service will cost you under $6 if you don’t want to walk to any of the destinations listed above.
Three blocks away is the historic Rideau canal – waterway that has dedicated bike, walk, and run paths, not to mention the Rideau river. Boat tours are plentiful.

A/C is provided via a stand alone unit (summer only).

If you need to workout, GoodLife fitness open 4/24 is on Bank and Queen street which is less than 1 km away. The YMCA is closer south of the apartment.

neighborhood_overview:
I LOVE Wellington West - it's lively and fun, but we're one block off the 'main drag', so our location is quiet at night. This is a friendly, up-scale, inner-city arts district where I know everybody. We walk to everything we need: grocers & delis, farmer's market, specialty shopping, parks, churches, theaters, galleries, studios (art, yoga, gym, fitness), craft breweries, and a HUGE variety of cafes, pubs, restaurants & eateries in all ethnicities and price-ranges... this artsy 'hood is known as "Ottawa's Gastro Alley"!
We are 1 block from Tunney's Pasture Station, a 20 minute walk to the Civic Hospital, and a 20 minute drive to Gatineau Park.

description:

Large windows on both sides of the living room allow for a comfortable cross breeze.

Canadian Musuem of Nature is 2 blocks away.  In 7 years I've been in the neighbourhood I've never had a safety or security problem.

One of Ottawa's trendiest neighbourhoods, Hintonburg and Wellington West were singled out by Ottawa Magazine as "one of Ottawa's 20 best neighbourhoods":
While some people mourn the loss of the bingo parlours and pawnshops that once studded Wellington Street, others have welcomed with open arms the arrival of chic restaurants and quirky shops. From the high-end fare at Back Lane Café to the luxury yarns at Wabi Sabi, Hintonburg is definitely moving on up."

description:
Enjoy beautiful Constance Bay just 20 minutes from Ottawa. Not only do you get the privacy of your own room and use of all amenities but also step outside and feel free to borrow any of our kayaks and go for a nice paddle down the river . The beach is beautiful and you are welcome to enjoy that as well. Just a short drive the other way and you can enjoy white water rafting, exploring the Bonnechere caves and so much more. Make yourself at home !

The space
Your private room consists of one queen sized bed, dresser and a roll out cot if you need an extra bed .

Guest access
Enjoy the use of the kitchen , bathroom ( of course!! we supply the towels) and share our living room. You have free Wi-Fi .You are welcome to enjoy our back yard and the beautiful Ottawa river is just a few steps away. Our kayaks are here for you to enjoy.
neighborhood_overview: We are nestled in a cottage community . The neighbourhood is a mix of cottages and year round homes.   We have lots of beach front for you to enjoy. There are 2 main beaches , 1 family oriented and 1 more for the party crowd ; The Point Lounge , a local hot spot is housed there . We have a general store which doubles as a beer/liquor store ,  a drug store and Happy Times , probably the best Pizza around. Happy Times won an award a few years back for its Pizza. We also have another small restaurant called The Lighthouse which is popular for breakfast . We are surrounded by the Torbolton Forest which is home to an abundance of flora and fauna.

neighborhood_overview: This old Ottawa neighbourhood in what is called West Centertown, provides convenient access to a host of physical and cultural activities, including the Gladstone Theatre which is just a few blocks away.You are steps away from the Plant Bath facility, which offers inexpensive access to a children's pool, a full size swimming pool, dry sauna and complete exercise facility. The UNESCO World Heritage designated Rideau Canal and Dow's Lake is a 10 minute walk ;you can enjoy the Skateway in winter, boating and cycling in the summer. In  the other direction, the St John A MacDonald  (Ottawa River) Parkway offers many kilometres of bike and walking trails within a 10 minute walk or 5 minute cycle. We are equidistant from Carleton and Ottawa Universities--one a short bus ride the other within walking distance. We are also a short bus ride to Landsdowne Park, home of the Ottawa Red Blacks and Ottawa Fury.

neighborhood_overview:
This amazing place is located just on the fringe of Little Italy and Chinatown, and is a short walk to mass transit (all major lines going East and West and 5 minute walk to O-Train)

Walk South on Preston and explore little shops and cafés or wonder to Dow's Lake and enjoy beautiful parks and Canada's Arboretum (Experimental Farms) - the perfect place for a picnic, sitting next to the famed Rideau Canal. On your trek South on Preston I recommend stopping in for a bite at Pubwells, a picnic snack or your deli and cheeses at Luciano's, a coffee or snack at Bridgehead Coffee, or brunch at Stoneface Dolly's to name a few. Go East on Somerset Street and explore Ottawa's Chinatown or head West and hip-it-up in the up and coming Hintonburg neighbourhood. You can also walk to the core of downtown or Parliament Hill in 20 minutes or take a 5 minute bus/taxi/uber ride.

Relax, play, enjoy and stay right in the heart of it all!

All of these neighbourhoods include Ottawa's best restaurants and bars, parks, museums, and all the major attractions.

- Bathroom: Large shower. Towels, shampoo,

neighborhood_overview:
Sandy Hill is a neighbourhood in Ottawa, located just east of downtown. The neighbourhood is bordered on the west by the Rideau Canal and on the east by the Rideau River. To the north it stretches to Rideau Street and the Byward Market area while to the south it is bordered by the Queensway highway and Nicholas Street. It is home to a number of embassies, residences and parks. Le cordon bleu operates its Canadian school there, at the opposite end of Sandy Hill from the University of Ottawa.

Byward Market -
Join some friends for brunch, lunch or dinner, and then hit the shops for the highest quality food products, fashions and cutting edge trends. See and be seen until the wee hours at one of our hip nightspots. Morning, noon and night the ByWard Market has something just for you. Established by Lt-Col. John By in 1826, the ByWard Market is one of Canada's oldest and largest public markets. The legendary builder of the Rideau Canal, Colonel By himself laid out the stree

neighborhood_overview:
Navan enjoys a substantial amount of green-space. Historically a rural farming community, the village enjoys an enviable community spirit.
The Navan Fair (Hosted in August) is a must-see. One friend, visiting from the UK, admitted he had never seen so many tractors in his life!
During the fair, you can dance under the Pope Domes and enjoy the Navan parade* Possibly the only parade in North America with more people participating than watching?
2mins -1.5 Km Navan Hockey arena (Finalist in the Kraft Hockey contest.)
2mins-1.5 km Navan curling club, agricultural building, ball diamond, park and fairground. Events happen under Navan’s famous Domes. Airlifted to the park in 1984 and used for the Papal Mass when Pope John Paul visited Canada; The Domes are located next to the local park and Curling Arena. During the Navan Fair Listen to live music under the Domes.)
-4km The Domaine Perrault Winery offers complimentary wine tasting in a relaxed atmosphere.

neighborhood_overview:
Preston Street is the heart of Ottawa's Little Italy neighbourhood. Renamed Corso Italia to reflect the Italian heritage of the area, it offers tree-lined streets, award-winning Italian and international cuisine and independent boutiques, making this one of Ottawa's most inviting neighborhoods. This is your cycle-friendly rest stop that links the City's two most picturesque cycling paths, the Ottawa River and the Rideau Canal Pathways. Park your bike here and enjoy one of the many sunny patios in this area. Centrally located in west Centretown between Dow's Lake and the Ottawa River, Little Italy is easily accessible to and from anywhere in the city. This is home to some of Ottawa's biggest festivals, Tulip Festival in May, Italian Week in June Blues Fest in July, and GrapeFest in September, but there is always something to do in Little Italy.

https://www.ottawatourism.ca/member/preston-street-bia-little-italy/

Some great places to eat few minutes from home as in the famous "The Swan at Carp" and its real canadian seasonal menu, from regular fare to bison and locally made chocolates...wow!

Nearby there are several Golf Courses, two ski hills, a local airport, Carp Market, Mississippi River, an Elk farm, river beaches

neighborhood_overview: "The Glebe" is one of Ottawa's most popular trendy neighbourhoods.  It is one neighbourhood out from the central core and is surrounded by the curve of the Rideau Canal. It has old brick houses and big trees with lots of different architecture, old and new. Our "main street" is an eight block section of Bank Street - Ottawa's main retail road that bisects the city and ends at Parliament Hill. On Bank Street ( a few minutes from my house) you will find many great restaurants, pubs and cafes, as well as unique small shops that attract people from all over the city. There are three grocery stores.  The big Lansdowne complex has the sports stadium, a Whole Foods, retail shopping, the weekend Farmer's Market, many eateries with outdoor patios, a big park, and a Cineplex. It's very lively, especially when there is a game or event on.  The Glebe is also adjacent to Dow's Lake (3 blocks from my house) where the Tulip Festival and Winterlude are held. Safe and happy travels!

neighborhood_overview:
THIS is where you want to be! Right on the bustling Rideau Street and near everything Ottawa has to offer! It doesn't get any better than this.

Museums, museums, and more museums. This location has over a dozen museums in proximity (nature, war, postal, history, science & technology, agriculture, civilization, etc.)

Or, spend the day relaxing in the largest thermal spa in North America; Nordik Spa-Nature, situated only 10 minutes way.

Perhaps you'd like to try your luck against the one-armed-bandits? You are a short 15 minutes drive to the "Lac-Lemay" Casino in Hull!

Then, finish off by watching the sunset on a hilltop in the Gatineau Park.

These are just a few suggestions of activities to do during your time here. Once you book your stay with us, be sure to check out the Guestbook for more details and other "MUST-DO" items in Ottawa.

neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a lively and hip neighbourhood. Special features that are just a few minutes away by foot from the apartment include:

1. Wellington Street: home to lots of restaurants and cute stores. A small grocery store is walking distance to the apartment. Large chain grocery stores are better reached by bike, bus, or car.

2. The Parkdale Market: this lively market is open daily from April to November, 6am to 6pm. You can find an array of fresh fruit, vegetables, and plants there.

3. Laroche Park: offers a large open field with two baseball diamonds, a children's play area, and an off-leash dog park.

4. Gatineau River Trail: you can enjoy a relaxing walk, run, bike ride, or (in the winter) cross-country skiing along the river. You can also use the trail for a scenic commute to downtown.

description:
Fantastic location in the heart of the Byward Market, just a short walk to major attractions, museums, great food and nightlife.

1-bedroom apartment with private entrance and free on-site parking. Sleeps 4 adults comfortably.

Bathroom and living areas recently renovated. Fully-equipped, clean kitchen is always stalked with coffee and tea.

Customer service focused host is always available in English, français, italiano y español.

The space
The apartment is on the ground floor, but a total of 5 stairs must be climbed to access the unit.

2 beds are available: 1 King in the bedroom, and 1 Double (sofa bed) in the living room.

The kitchen is equipped with a full-sized microwave, as well an apartment-sized fridge and stove. Coffee will never be a problem, as Drip, French Press, and stove-top espresso (Moka Pot) coffee-making equipment is available.

Guest access
Unit is a private apartment
neighborhood_overview: The Byward Market is home to many of Ottawa’s premiere attractions.  Originally established in the 1820s during the construction of the Rideau Canal, it is now known for its nightlife, great food, and world-class urban experience.

description:
Welcome to my lovely Edwardian home minutes away from Parliament Hill. While this beauty will take you back to a gentler era, the home is updated with all the mod cons. From the wood burning fireplace to the backyard urban oasis you and your friends are steps away from shopping, local bars, restaurants and museums and much more in Canada's capital city. At the end of the day you can retreat to this comfortable home to share your experiences and enjoy a good night's sleep.

The space
This elegant Edwardian home has the grace of its period with the modern conveniences. It is decorated for beauty and comfort so that after a busy day of sightseeing and activity you can retreat to its comforts. There are several outdoor spaces including a recently landscaped backyard urban oasis and several balconies and decks to watch the world go by or just to relax with a cup of coffee and a book.

Guest access
You will have a fully equipped kitchen with ever
neighborhood_overview: This neighbourhood is only a few blocks from downtown and Parliament Hill but when you sit outside amidst the mature trees listening to bird songs you can imagine that you are far away from the city centre. Everything is accessible on foot and close to public transit. You really don't need a car unless you want to travel to the countryside. Shops for all your needs are within walking distance. We are a short walk to the UNESCO World Heritage Rideau Canal, where you can walk or cycle for kilometres on end. Cultural facilities are also located close by. It is hard to imagine a better location to have both a quiet retreat and easy access to the city.

description:
Downtown retreat!

2 Full Bedrooms. Sleeps 6! Luxurious, Clean, and Spacious! The perfect home away from home with all the hotel comforts and more! Minutes away from Downtown, Byward Market, Rideau Shopping Center, Rideau Canal, and Parliament Hill! No better place to discover Ottawa.

Parking Options available!

In addition to the essentials, this location is equipped with:
- SmartTV (Netflix, youtube ...)
- Unlimited High Speed Internet
- Full Kitchen
- Washer/Dryer
- New AC setup for each room as of June 2019

Safe and happy travels!

The space
This unit has two separate bedrooms for two couples, friends, or parents with children. A wonderful living room area which offers a Smart TV that allows Netflix and YouTube. Additionally, a modern kitchen with Granite Countertops, Stainless Steel Fridge/Stove, Washer/Dryer, fully renovated bathroom as well as access to a balcony!

Guest access<
neighborhood_overview:
THIS is where you want to be! Right on the bustling Rideau Street and near everything Ottawa has to offer! It doesn't get any better.

Museums, museums, and more museums. This location has over a dozen museums in proximity (nature, war, postal, history, science & technology, agriculture, civilization, etc.)

Or, spend the day relaxing in the largest thermal spa in North America; Nordik Spa-Nature, situated only 10 minutes way.

Perhaps you'd like to try your luck against the one-armed-bandits? You are a short 15 minutes drive to the "Lac-Lemay" Casino in Hull!

Then, finish off by watching the sunset on a hilltop in the Gatineau Park.

These are just a few suggestions of activities to do during your time here. Once you book your stay with us, be sure to check out the Guestbook for more details and other "MUST-DO" items in Ottawa.

description:
8 Hartington Place is a unique 3 bedroom 1800 square ft. rebuilt 120 year-old Victorian Home in the Heart of the Golden Triangle equipped with its own gated parking spot and all the amenities that spell luxury & prestige. Decorated with original art and top quality beds, linens, towels, furniture you enter a place of luxury and comfort you can call home. Our home is 2 blocks from Rideau Canal and 4 Bl. from Parliament Hill. It's available - June 2018 - in the heart of the entertainment district

The space
What makes Hartington Place unique is how you feel when you walk into the space with original high ceilings, moldings, stained glass and light that enters through windows of this corner lot. Totally rebuilt, the inside of the home is perfect for larger family rental -- sleeps 8 (1 king, 2 queens and one queen roll out.) The basement is a separate unit with bathroom and lounge space. The home has all amenities, including wireless internet, cable TV, in suite lau
neighborhood_overview: What is unique about the Golden Triangle is that in this downtown core you have a village feel. You are safe and surrounded by professionals and people that call this area their home but yet just far enough away from the hustle and bustle of the entertainment district. You may not ever drive your car and leave this fully contained location. Everything you need a stones throw. Starbucks and Bridgehead are one block away... Great Yoga studio 2 blocks away.... Bike path 2 blocks away.... Byward Market a 5 min. bike ride.... City Hall and Parliament hill a 5 min. bike ride....

description:
Great student room. Single bed and desk in a private room. Steps from the Rideau Canal , Bank Street , Landsdowne Park and TD Place. Located in the quaint neighborhood of the Glebe, Ottawa's most desirable enclave. We are close to downtown , Carleton and Ottawa Universities , Ottawa Hospital and everything good in Ottawa. You’ll love our large family house because of the warm cozy atmosphere,and the charming neighborhood.

The space
You can share our kitchen and make yourself breakfast.

Guest access
Please feel free to share our living room, sun room, ground floor bathroom and kitchen.
The 3rd floor bathroom is just for our guests.
Please respect our privacy in the 2nd floor bedrooms and bathroom.
neighborhood_overview:
TD Place is across the street. Home of the Ottawa Renegades, Ottawa Fury, Ottawa 67's, and a major concert venue.

neighborhood_overview:
Look for the identifying plaques on the heritage buildings throughout Sandy Hill. Range Rd., (Embassy Row) is lined with embassies two of which are our neighbors in the back. Pack a picnic and walk 4 minutes to Strathcona Park where children can be seen playing in its sand castle and swings. In the winter you might catch a glimpse of a cross country skier or two. While at the park, stroll along the Ottawa River, home of ducks and two swans, or walk to the park's entrance on Laurier Avenue and make a wish at the fountain. There are more embassies on Laurier but almost directly across the street is the famous Cordon Bleu Culinary Institute. You will need to make advance reservations for lunch or dinner there. BTW: The stop light that is around the corner from the Russian Embassy is Rideau St. which becomes Wellington St. (Direction West...i.e. left turn), address of the Senate & Parliament, Library & Archives and the Bank of Canada.

description:
The sunniest condo in Ottawa! Come stay in a modern, bright condo situated between Chinatown & Little Italy. You will be steps away from great food, minutes away from museums and a 10 min walk from the Ottawa river ( great for bike rides!).

The space
My place is perfect for friends & couples looking to relax & explore different sides of Ottawa. Chinatown & Little Italy are Ottawa's most diverse neighborhoods with long-standing Italian, Vietnamese, Chinese and Thai communities.

If you like to explore on foot or by bike, you'll have no shortage of paths along the Ottawa river & Rideau Canal - a quick 10 min walk from the condo.

If you're interested in the big tourist sites- the Parliment, Rideau canal locks, Major Hill Park etc., you're a quick 20 min walk away, either through the heart of the city or along the Ottawa River.

Guest access
During your stay, you'll have access to the entire condo: living room, bedroom, bat
neighborhood_overview:
My condo sits between Ottawa's Chinatown & Little Italy neighborhoods.

Chinatown is a vibrant business and residential area with a wide variety of affordable restaurants & cafes ( including the best Kareoke in town at Shanghai). The area features merchants from all over the world including Chinese, Korean, Thai, Vietnamese, Indian, Philippino, Spanish, Lebanese, French and Middle Eastern.

Preston Street is the heart of Ottawa's Little Italy neighbourhood. Renamed Corso Italia to reflect the Italian heritage of the area, it offers tree-lined streets, award-winning Italian and international cuisine and independent boutiques, making this one of Ottawa's most inviting neighbourhoods. This is your cycle-friendly rest stop that links the City's two most picturesque cycling paths, the Ottawa River and the Rideau Canal Pathways. Park your bike here and enjoy one of the many sunny patios in this area. Centrally located in west Centretown between Dow's Lake and the War Mus

description:
Newly built, bright and contemporary 1 bedroom apartment. This well equipped space has everything you need for a comfortable stay in Ottawa.

Our house is located in Old Ottawa South, between the Rideau River and the Rideau Canal, two blocks from trendy bank street and a quick bike ride or bus to downtown.

Walk out your private entrance directly into the 10 acre gem of Windsor park. Enjoy a game of tennis or basketball, a dip in the wading pool or an evening paddle on the Rideau in our canoe.

The space
We fell in love with this house because it backs right on to such a lovely park and the Rideau River. We never thought we'd find a place like this in such a central neighbourhood. It's the best of both worlds. You can spend the morning on the Rideau River, spotting beavers, blue herons and turtles, then bike downtown along the canal, walk around Parliament Hill and have dinner in the Byward Market. I've spent the last two years renovating thi
neighborhood_overview: Old Ottawa South, situated between the Rideau River to the south and the Rideau Canal to the north, is one of Ottawa's most vibrant communities. We're a 5 minute walk to Bank Street which has coffee shops, restaurants, shopping and an independent movie theatre. Within a ten minute walk is the newly redeveloped Lansdowne Park which tons of trendy restaurants, a Whole Foods, Cineplex Odeon, and TD Place stadium for concerts and sporting events.

Close to bus routes going to directly to OttawaU and to the Byward Market. Arts and cultural tourist locations are no more than 10 minutes drive to Parliament, Museums, government offices.

Great for solo adventurers, interns, and business travellers.

It is a large private room with a Double cast iron bed, antique dresser with large mirror, armoire and love seat. 2 washrooms available the guest- powder room on the main floor, and a full bathroom on the second floor which as been newly renovated. neighborhood_overview: Beechwood Village is a diverse community, located 8 min. drive, 15 min bus ride east of the Byward Market.  The neighborhood is quite and the neighbors are friendly.  Several fine dinning restaurants, Bridgehead Fair Trade Coffee Shop, Metro grocery store. Many cheep eat dinner up on Montreal Rd. like Eddy’s Dinner or Vanier Grill for a Canadian Breakfast with two eggs, bacon toast and coffee for $4.50. Several parks with pools and play areas in the neighborhood. Biking trails along the Ottawa River or simple bike lanes on regular roads. Parking is fairly simple in the city of Ottawa as well.

In the other directions you will come upon the By Ward Market and National Gallery, Elgin Street in the Golden Triangle and the Museum of Nature and then at the other end of Elgin you pass the Ottawa Courthouse and then The National Arts Centre before reaching Parliament Hill.  Or walk along the canal towards Carleton University to explore the Hogs Back Lock Station.

Comfortable, spacious living area. It has three bedrooms, 2 with full private Ensuite bathrooms, the third room has a sink,toilet and shower, without a tub. A fully equipped kitchen, washer/dryer. Air conditioned. It does not have Cable T.V., it has Apple T.V. Netflix etc. Unlimited WIFI

Guest access
You will have access to the entire home.

description:
Enjoy some quality time in this spacious and comfortable master bedroom with ensuite bathroom. Make yourself a gourmet breakfast or dinner in the fully equipped French kitchen. Treat yourself to a drink in the hot tub, or curl up with a book on the couch by the Napoleon gas stove. Walk, bike or ski the many trails in nearby Greenboro park. Only 15 minutes by car to downtown Ottawa and less than 10 minutes to the airport. Why settle for an airport hotel when you can have your own private resort?

The space
You will love the oversized bedroom. With its queen-size bed, loveseat, desk, and ensuite bathroom, it feels like a studio. The bed boasts a luxury mattress topper, cotton linens, and hypo-allergenic duvets. The Napoleon gas stove keeps the space warm and cosy. The ensuite bathroom is complete with a double sink vanity, corner shower, and oversized bathtub. And the hot tub is just a couple of steps away from the kitchen patio door.

Guest access<
neighborhood_overview: My neighbourhood is quiet, residential, family-oriented, and culturally diverse. There are many parks, playgrounds, and recreational trails just a few steps away. A major shopping mall (South Keys) - with grocery store, bank, electronics store and several food outlets and chain stores such as Winners, Homesense, Wal-mart, The Source) is 2.5 km away.There are several gas stations around, as well as a little strip mall with a convenience store and a pharmacy within 1 km. If you are looking for a restaurant, KS (Daze Street) is a great family restaurant with excellent food (try their pizzas!) and two patios across the road from the South Keys shopping mall.

neighborhood_overview: My heritage home is centrally located with a 10 minute drive downtown.  2 bus routes within a block which will take you downtown in 15 minutes. Walk or bike ride will take you to the NCC Scenic Driveway which meanders through the Central Experimental Farm, the Canada Agriculture and Food Museum, the Dominium Arboretum, and the Fletcher Wildlife Garden. Once here you can walk or bike along the 8 km pathways along Ottawa's beautiful Rideau Canal. Rent a canoe, kayak, paddle-board or paddle boat and enjoy the view from the water. You eventually end up in downtown Ottawa and could spend the rest of your day exploring our Byward Market where you can discover the many restaurants,  Museums, Parliament Hill, parks, local shops and the Rideau Centre shopping available to you.

description:
A perfectly central landing spot for your visit to the Nation's Capital. From our doorstep, you have easy access to Parliament and the vibrant ByWard Market either by bus or on foot. Explore Ottawa's stunning green space with a short stroll to Dow's Lake and the Rideau Canal.

Perched at the junction of some of Ottawa's trendiest neighbourhoods and restaurants, you are surrounded by all the city has to offer in this renovated century home.

The listing is for one bedroom.

Guest access
While you're here please make yourself at home. We have a cozy living area, and a well equipped kitchen/dining area that you are welcome to use. We only ask that you leave these areas as tidy as you found them.

Other things to note
We do not have a parking space at our home. Street parking on our street or the adjacent streets is typically easy to find, however we always advise that guests pay careful attention to street signage.
neighborhood_overview: We are perched right between Ottawa's Centretown, Chinatown, and Glebe neighbourhoods and all of the restaurants, shopping, and activities they offer. Public transit is literally steps away, though the location is so walkable to everything that you may never need it. It is an easy walk or bus ride to Parliament and the vibrant ByWard Market and a short stroll to Dow's Lake and the Rideau Canal.

neighborhood_overview: Orléans is a suburb of Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. It is located in the eastern part of the city along the Ottawa River, about 16 km (10 mi) from downtown Ottawa. The Canada 2011 Census determined that Orléans' population was 107,823. Today, Orléans spans the municipal wards of Orléans, Innes and Cumberland. Orléans is one of 3 areas[which?] of the post-amalgamated City of Ottawa to contain a significant francophone population, hence the community's name.

neighborhood_overview: This is a family home nestled into a family neighborhood with large properties.  Everyone appreciates their peace and quiet.  A little walk down the street there is a cut through to a neighboring community and you will find a lovely park. A little further walk away and there is a fantastic forest walk that is maintained by the National Capital Commission. A short drive would give you access to many more NCC trails that are groomed for x-country in the winter and there is lots of sledding at Mooney's Bay (10 min drive).

neighborhood_overview:
Located in Old Ottawa East, our house is the perfect intersection between a vibrant community and a sophisticated development. Inside is urban living at its finest. Outside are countless green spaces and riverside trails in the midst of a diverse, colourful neighbourhood.

Bordered by the Rideau Canal and Rideau River, Old Ottawa East is just minutes from Ottawa’s downtown core. Corners on Main boasts a perfect 100 bike-ability score. This cyclist’s paradise has winding bike paths traversing the parks and crisscrossing the neighborhood. If you prefer to wander on foot, there is plenty to keep you occupied; from boutique shops to farmers' markets. Everything you need is right around the corner.

description:
Welcome to your country cottage in the city!

This cozy little home is just steps from cafés, restaurants and a farmer's market.

We hope you'll enjoy the comfy bed, as well as the many handmade furniture and art pieces lovingly created by us and our families.

This home is nearly 100 years old and has the character to match. You'll get to enjoy the original mouldings and hardwood floors, as well as an equipped kitchen and newly-renovated bathroom with walk-in shower.

Tea and coffee included!

The space
Your home away from home is on a quiet street that is close to everything. You'll be just a short walking distance to:

1 min:
-Cafes, restaurants, groceries, bus stop, convenience store

5 mins:
-Pharmacy, pubs, book store, gyms, spa, walking/biking paths, Crichton Street Gallery, plus more cafes and restaurants

10 mins
-Governor General's Residence (and public skating rink) a
neighborhood_overview: You'll be in historic New Edinburgh, where Canada's Prime Minister and Governor General live.  This neighbourhood has a little of everything, including a number of embassies and little hidden gems like a swimming pond, outdoor skating rinks and handy walking/bike paths. It is sandwiched between the fancy mansions of Rockcliffe Park and the up-and-coming neighbourhood of Vanier. The nearby bus stop will take you quickly to the trendy Byward Market, Parliament Hill or the Rideau Canal.

Full kitchen is equipped with small appliances, microwave and full size refrigerator with freezer and ice-maker, stove/oven and dishwasher. neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to Canada's national Capital region.
Kanata is the silicon valley of the North - the Kanata High Tech sector is our neighbour. If you are a business traveller and require convenient accommodation in the heart of the Kanata's high tech sector, stay in this beautiful private house and get to your workplace and after hour amenities in mere minutes.
Come enjoy all that the city of Ottawa has to offer. Our city has festivals year round - Music, Food, Culture, Art and outdoor activities. We have Winterlude and the Rideau Canal skate-way. We have the Tulip festival and we have the National capital marathon. Our sports venues are some of the best in the world - we have NHL Hockey, CFL Football, Fury Soccer and world class Equestrian at Wesley Clover Parks, just to name a few.
The neighbourhood is primarily residential but close to shopping, restaurants and entertainment. It is a fully planned community - walking trails are plenty, natural forest areas have been preserved

Located just off of the main street in Vanier, an emerging neighborhood that:

- is not far from the University of Ottawa, downtown, parliament & "the market" neighbourhood

- hosts the city's largest cemetery

description:
Character-filled semi-detached two-bedroom plus den house overlooking Macdonald Gardens Park near Downtown Ottawa. Architectural details compliment the living and dining rooms. A bright renovated kitchen gives access to the large rear deck.

The space
The place is private and cozy in an established residential neighbourhood downtown, yet very modern inside - it was renovated in 2014. The location is ideal as well, you can leave your car and walk to most of Ottawa's central attractions (such as the Byward market, University of Ottawa, Parliment Hill and the Rideau Centre), with others a short bus or taxi ride away.

description:
A tastefully decorated and well equipped upper level apartment with a private walk-up entrance and free parking. In the heart of Westboro Village, one of Ottawa's most desirable neighbourhoods—Enjoy a central location without the hassles of downtown.

The space
This ideal executive suite boasts a cozy bedroom and a separate office space, perfect for anyone who needs plenty of space to relax and work. A large open-concept kitchen and dining area connect to a beautiful living room with a gas fireplace and a large sun-drenched deck overlooking a backyard garden.

You'll be lulled by the restful ambiance in this home on a calm cul-de-sac, but you'll also be tempted to put on your walking shoes and explore the area. Westboro's trendy village main street, with its coffee shops and specialty boutiques, is just beyond the doorstep! Within a ten minute walk along Richmond Road, there is something for your every mood: find ingredients for a great home-cooked meal
neighborhood_overview: Westboro Village is a century-old community, and was once the heart of Nepean Township. The old stone town hall still proudly stands on Richmond Road, the original route westward from Bytown. Three blocks to the west is Maplelawn manor, Ottawa's second oldest building (built in 1831) and a National Historic site, which now houses a Keg steak restaurant and features a vintage walled garden open to the public.

Who does not want to live in a condo over a hotel on top of an art gallery with panoramic city views from a sophisticated condominium in the heart of downtown Ottawa

neighborhood_overview:
On the edge of the ByWard Market, ArtHaus benefits from an ideal LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION

The extravagant redevelopment of Rideau Centre, along with ByWard Market’s unique array of specialty shops and fashion boutiques makes for a world class shopping experience.

Furthermore, a few steps away from your lobby, is the center of the city’s thriving creative scene, with exhibitions from the top local and world-renowned artists showcased right in your neighbourhood.

Quaint cafes and patisseries give ByWard Market an old time charm, while the city’s top-rated fine dining establishments and chic cocktail lounges provide the luxe contemporary feel of urban life. Endless culinary variety is yours as every type of cuisine offers up a new cultural experience.

neighborhood_overview: Bordering New Edinburgh and Rockcliffe Park, Beechwood Village is a charming neighborhood with many national landmarks. From the grounds of the Governor General's residence at Rideau Hall, to beautiful Beechwood Cemetery there is a wide choice of places to visit on bike or on foot. The peaceful paths of the Ottawa river are nearby and the vibrant Byward Market is only a short ride over the St. Patrick Street bridge. Village Suites is walking distance to the shops of Beechwood Avenue where good coffee, fresh flowers, warm bread or a bus stop are at your fingertips.

neighborhood_overview: We live on a street with very little traffic but we're close to so many amenities! Wild rabbits, squirrels and an array of birds are seen and heard all around. Only steps away from the property is Gilbey Park. You'll find wooded walking/bike trails & a playground for kids - We do our morning workout here most days. Pass the park, you'll find plazas with a Tutti Fruiti (Breakfast/Lunch/Brunch), Shoppers Drug Mart, Food Basics, Bulk Barn, Nice One Nail salon, Nando's chicken, Ghana (Indian take-out) restaurants. Loblaws plaza across the street has more groceries which sells VQA wines, Starbucks, Booster Juice, RBC, gym, fuel station and more. Walmart Super Centre is across Baseline from there with more restaurants, shopping and services. Down the street, Barley Mow's has great food, a wide array of beverages and many screens to watch the game. If you happen to indulge in a few too many cocktails, it's only a 5 minute walk up the street to your abode for the evening, no need for Uber:) -

neighborhood_overview:
Parks, woods and the mighty Ottawa River are all around you. Wind surfing, Westboro and Britannia beaches nearby. Visit Remic Rapids, off river parkway, to experience renowned stone structures balanced in the water.
The biggest Ikea in Canada is just a km away, and have you ever visited Lee Valley Tools? Paradise for woodworkers and serious gardeners. Just over the Hwy 417 overpass.
Be downtown in 10 minutes, or take one of four bridges across Ottawa River/rivière Outoaious to Quebec and experience Francophone culture just across the river.

The space
We have created this space with the tired traveler in mind. The kitchen is fully equipped to handle any cooking challenge. The downstairs bedroom is warm and inviting with a new IKEA bed and mattress. Laundry can be done in the suite. New Ottawa rules on minimum length of stay. Please contact us for more information.

neighborhood_overview:
You are in the heart of an established centuries old area called the Glebe, a very hip and urban suburb that really has all you need for entertainment & shopping. Lined by beautiful Victorian style homes with “Ma and Pa” shops from boutiques, bakeries, grocers, banks, pharmacies, specialty cafés, fine dining, casual dining, and pubs.
You are a five minute walk to the scenic Rideau canal, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, where you can bike/walk/run along tree-lined paths or ice-skate in the winter along the longest skating canal in the world.
Parliament Hill is close enough to walk but easy public transit on OC-Transpo (a two-minute walk) will have you there in ten minutes.
The Lansdowne development has brought a new vibe with trendy nightclubs and restaurants, green space with skatepark and play structures, a Whole Foods grocery store and a modern theatre build around the Lansdowne stadium which is home to the Ottawa Red Blacks (CFL), the Ottawa Fury (ASL) and the Ott

The space

The home is ideal for a couple. However, at the front of the house, there is an office with a desk, single pull-out couch (picture out of date) and sliding doors that could double as a seco

The house is right between Westboro and Wellington West, both neighbourhoods with a ton of great shops, restaurants and cafés. Check out our guidebooks for recommendations.

There are two grocery stores and two liquor stores within a 5 minute walk from the house, which is incredibly convenient.

neighborhood_overview:
Crystal Beach is located in the west end of Ottawa next to the National Capital Commission Green Belt and close to the Ottawa River. It is a well established residential community comprised of mostly bungalow and split level homes built in the 1960's.
Local shopping, groceries, pharamcies and restaurants are a few minutes away in Bells Corners to the south and a variety of small stores, restaurants and cafes, Cineplex Cinemas and Bayshore Shopping Centre to the East. A little further to the west is the 19th Tee driving range and mini putt and some local produce stands.
