description:
Charming home in Westboro Village; safe and thriving neighbourhood.
Bright light pours in every room, eclectic decor with an incredible plant collection - this house is buzzing with good energy.
Enjoy the walkability of Westboro while exploring the many coffee shops, restaurants & boutiques.
5 minute walk to Westboro Beach & transit way, 10 minute drive downtown.
Ideal for a professional on business or a couple visiting Ottawa.
You will feel right at home in this unique living space.

The space
50's two-story home has windows throughout the house which keep the space well lit all day. The rooms are bursting with plant life, making it feel like a jungle.

Guest access
Full house access includes bedroom with queen bed and bathroom on the second floor, dining room with fully equipped kitchen and a spacious living room on the first floor. In warmer months enjoy both balconies and the backyard.
neighborhood_overview:
Westboro (often referred to as Westboro Village) is an area in the west end of Ottawa, Ontario. Located along the Ottawa River, Island Park Drive defines the Westboro's eastern border, while The Ottawa River defines its northern border.
Westboro Village is one of the most unique and diverse neighbourhoods in Ottawa. You’ll enjoy tree-lined streets, shop in one-of-a-kind boutiques and popular stores, spend time in welcoming outdoor spaces, dine at Ottawa’s trendiest spots and enjoy the natural beauty of Westboro Beach and the scenic views of Gatineau Hills - all within walking distance.

Just off of Ottawa's Highway 417, you're mere minutes to/from Downtown Ottawa, Kanata, Nepean, Westboro, Hintonburg, & Barrhaven. neighborhood_overview:
Quaint, tree lined neighborhood steps away from unique restaurants, and shopping as well as immediate access to transit, the Ottawa River Parkway and Gatineau Park. Minutes away from fantastic neighborhoods including Westboro, Hintonburg, Kanata (Kanata Tech Centre and the Department of National Defense DND Campus), Nepean, Barrhaven (RCMP headquarters), Gatineau and Downtown Ottawa via the Ottawa River Parkway.

We are surrounded by ample green space, which includes fabulous hiking and cycling trails. As well, we are only minutes away from the Ottawa River Parkway which runs directly to center of the city winding its way alongside the Ottawa River. A perfect place to walk, run, jog or cycle.

neighborhood_overview:
Located just off of the main street in Vanier, an emerging neighborhood that:

- is not far from the University of Ottawa, downtown, parliament & "the market" neighbourhood
- is walkable & bikeable
- is close to parks (including the Rideau River bicycle pathway and Strathcona Park)
- is a short walk to grocery & pharmacy store options
- has local dining options in the immediate neighbourhood - a 2-15 min walk (including breakfast, diner-style, coffee, asian, bars, fast food)
- has a summertime Saturday food market- the Beechwood Market
- hosts the city's largest cemetery

check out the neighborhood's blog: http://vaniernow.blogspot.ca/

description:
Updated older home in Alta Vista area, near the transit way, about 15 minutes from downtown. Close to bike path that runs along the Rideau River. It is lovely for a single person or couple that like peace and quiet once they get back to the house. There is small fridge, Kuerig coffee maker and kettle in the room, as well as a writing desk. The private bathroom is recently renovated and there is off road parking available.

The space
Double bedroom with closet space, good light control blinds and curtains. Looks onto beautiful quiet garden with lots of birds.
Private upgraded bathroom.

Guest access
Coffee and tea are provided as well as condiments.
There is a side range of home food delivery services available nearby.
There is a keyless keypad at the front door and I will provide the access code before you arrive.
Should you wish to leave your luggage to pick up for a late departure we can help with those arrangements.
neighborhood_overview: Alta Vista is a quiet residential neighbourhood with lots of trees. It is close to the Rideau River and a short walk to the Ottawa Hospital General Campus and the Riverside Hospital.  There is easy access to St Paul's University by foot, bike or by transit.

description:
Owner occupied home. Two private bedrooms and one private bathroom on the second floor. Sleeps 4. Access to kitchen for breakfast only. Private bathroom with bathtub & shower. The 2nd floor is entirely private. Only 3km to Canadian Tire Centre. Quiet neighbourhood. Rear of the house looks out to a large forested area. Free on site parking. Electronic door lock, come and go as you please. Anna and I live here. No smoking is allowed on the property.

Guest access
We only book one group at a time. No other guests will be staying during your booking. Absolutely no relatives or friends are permitted in our home. Because we live here the rest of the home is not available for your use. Minimal noise after 10:00 p.m. Free WIFI and cable TV. Parking is free. Room for 1 car on the driveway and free parking on the street. Clean linens, towels and toiletries are provided. No smoking allowed on the property.

Other things to note
Bread, jam, peanut butte

Bus stops 30 and 94 to downtown Ottawa and to many places are a few blocks away.

L’accueil très chaleureuse à la porte par moi-même. Je suis une personne Discrète et très accueillante, souriante, j'adores la compagnie. Rien ne me fait plus plaisir qu'acceuillir les gens, et passer d’agréable moments avec eux.

neighborhood_overview:
On est proche de beaucoup de magasins où ils peuvent faire un tour et passer du temps, un grand centre d’achat qui s’appelle « place d’Orléans » où ils peuvent faire leurs achats de toute sorte. Et c’est là la terminus de tous les bus qui vont et viennent dans toutes les directions. Il y a un bus à quelques mètres de la maison disponible qui y va chaque 15min.

Dans 500m de la maison il y a un arrêt de bus qui vont directement au centre ville. Seulement 3minutes de marche pour arriver à cet arrêt d’auto-bus.

neighborhood_overview: Centretown is a leafy residential district with a busy commercial core of clothes stores, brunch spots and lively Irish pubs on Elgin and Bank streets. The Rideau Canal is popular for its waterside trail and becomes an ice-skating rink in winter. Conveniently located between the Glebe, Westboro and the Market, Centretown is well placed for those who drive, walk or bike. You have your choice of grocery stores or farmers markets, casual diners or gourmet restaurants, yoga or kickboxing. With all of this and more, Centretown is the place where lifestyles are crafted and memories are made.

neighborhood_overview:
From Wikipedia (URL HIDDEN)

The Glebe is a neighbourhood in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. It is located just south of Ottawa's downtown area in the Capital Ward with its northern border being demarcated by the Queensway highway. It is bounded by the Rideau Canal to the south and east. Many maps show the western edge as Bronson Avenue, but some also include the triangle farther west formed by Bronson, Carling Avenue, and Dow's Lake. The Glebe Community Association uses the latter definition.[1] As of 2011, the area's population was 11,184.

The Glebe has a strong community association which, in addition to running a large community centre, lobbies the local government on issues such as traffic calming and neighbourhood development. The Glebe has a community newspaper, Glebe Report, that has been published independently since 1973.

The space
Our home



is a charming Bungalow on an Ottawa River sandy bay. We offer a lovely one bedroom unit on waterfront with food to prepare a continental breakfast. Well equipped open concept living/kitchen; spacious bedroom; double sided gas fire place; large bathroom with laundry facilities. Summer offers beach and water activities. Nearby winter activities include cross country skiing, ice fishing and ski do. Accessible from ski do and river.

neighborhood_overview: Our village is Ottawa's best kept secret.  The Torbolton Forest anchors our recreational trails.  When you arrive, the river is well hidden- we love it that way.  You can walk for about 12 km of beach. About ten minutes up the beach, you will find a beach shack pub. Music is sometimes provided- my husband plays bass on a Sunday afternoon, with a group of buddies.  The river is large, very attractive and has a safe bay.  Water access slope is gradual, it's an ideal spot for families to enjoy swimming. From our side we have a lovely view of the Gatineau Hills.  Sport fishing is very popular, as are other water activities.

Cuisine et salle à diner, court extérieure avec set patio ouvert l'été.
Stationnement "V43" peut être assigné à un visiteur du groupe.

description:
Big and bright family home located centrally in Old Ottawa South. It's a short walk to the shops on Bank Street, TD Place at Landsdowne Park, and everything the Glebe has to offer.

The bus stops next to our house and will take you to Centretown, Parliament Hill and the Market in 15 minutes.

We're also convenient to a couple bike paths if you want to explore the city that way. Also a short walk to Windsor park and the Rideau River.

The space
This is our family home, and our family includes a precocious two-year-old, so there will be her belongings around, but we'll keep most of her things in her playroom.

We don't have central air, but we have a couple portable A/C units upstairs. We have casement windows so we had to jerry-rig the units to fit, but they work well.

We have a couple cats, but will board them during your stay.

We don't have a TV, but can setup a 27" monitor with speakers in the living room wit

neighborhood_overview: Centretown is a leafy residential district with a busy commercial core of clothes stores, brunch spots and lively Irish pubs on Elgin and Bank streets. The Rideau Canal is popular for its waterside trail and becomes an ice-skating rink in winter, while Dundonald and Jack Purcell parks are dotted with monuments and public artwork. The Canadian Museum of Nature has exhibits on Arctic fossils and polar bears.

description:
Angela's B&B is a large old rambling family house located in central Ottawa on unceded Algonquin territory.
The room is on the second floor with a queen bed. All bathrooms are shared. If needed, it is possible to add a single cot into the room (no additional charge). The book shelf has a small selection of philosophy books.
Accommodation includes unlimited organic fair-trade coffee and tea. If desired a full, mostly organic breakfast is available for $15.00.

The space
We love to welcome guests into our home who have interesting tales to tell and hold politically progressive and eco-friendly values. We believe that a better world is possible. We strive to live with a lower carbon and environmental footprint.

The large old house has high-speed wifi and a large backyard where we try to grow organic vegetables, BBQ and hold music, poetry and fund-raising shows. You can chill in the backyard; we can lend you a bike to get around; our house can be
neighborhood_overview:
Angela’s place is located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.
Angela's Bed & Breakfast is located in the Glebe, which is a central, treed, urban, thriving neighbourhood. Two blocks from the house you can find coffee shops, restaurants, grocery, pharmacy, boutiques, post office, wine bar, whatever.

Step inside this heritage home and explore the unique architecture as you learn about its vibrant past. Our home is nestled in a quiet street surrounded by local landmarks and steps away from the best restaurants, shopping, and nightlife Ottawa has to offer. We have renovated our amenities and restored our floors and ceiling but have kept the rustic charm.

The space
In the core of the ByWard Market, you are perfectly located for business or holiday! The recently updated flat is situated in a heritage home; Giving you the benefits of old and new! We are mere meters away from a plethora of restaurants and shops but on one of the quietest streets in the Market. Our beautiful apartment was carefully designed to be fully equipped for maximum comfort and a memorable stay!

description:
Updated 3 bdrm/1.5 bath apartment, located right in the heart of trendy Westboro, a family friendly borough known for great stores and restaurants. Steps from transit line and close to bike paths makes this spot ideal for visiting Ottawa.

The space
We recently bought and renovated a triplex. Our unit is the top floor.

We have approximately 1200 square feet. The three bedrooms and full bath are in the back of the unit. The open-concept kitchen, dining and living room are at the front.

The large windows are one of our favourite features. They let in a lot of natural light, but are high efficiency.

There is also a spacious yard. We haven't yet spent much time on landscaping, but it would provide a nice alternative to the indoors.
Our tenants in the other units are really nice, professional couples.

We are also within a block and a half from a grocery store, liquor store, bakery, and gas station.

Guest
neighborhood_overview:
Westboro is a vibrant, family friendly community. Richmond Road is lined with many boutiques and better known stores, cafés, yoga studios, and restaurants. Be sure to check out the market Saturday mornings.

For those with children, there are several neighbourhood parks with fun structures within a few blocks. There are extensive trails along the Ottawa River and nearby Westboro Beach about a 10 minute walk away.

Some must tries very close-by:
-Trio, with a boho atmosphere and delectable small plates.
- Gezellig is owned by a reputable restaurateur. It's nice because you can get any two plates for $22. It has a modern, simple decor.
-Baker Street Cafe for one of the most popular breakfasts in town. Best time to beat the line is during the week.

Also close by:

description:
In the SUMMER, we ONLY rent FULL WEEKS Sunday to Sunday

Welcome to beautiful Constance Bay, a little piece of paradise only 20 minutes from Kanata, and 45 minutes to downtown Ottawa. This magical boutique is on the Ottawa River, and features a sandy waterfront with very gradual entry, which is perfect for both young and old. There are miles of sandy beaches to walk and explore, which make you feel like you are worlds away, but should you need to come into Kanata, it's a short 20 minute drive.

The space
The cottage has been fully renovated top to bottom, with no expense spared. There are new huge windows overlooking the Sandy Beach and water with Gatineau Hills in the backdrop. Quartz countertops in the open-concept kitchen (open to both dining and living room), large bathroom with separate toilet area, beautiful furniture, and luxurious beds. The list goes on and on. This is not your typical cottage; this is more like a beautiful pinterest home wi
neighborhood_overview:
Please note: Constance Bay is an adorable little beach town, but there isn’t a grocery store right there so please plan accordingly. The closest real grocery store is about 20 minutes away in Kanata (Sobey’s on March Road). There are 3 restaurants that do amazing pizza, chinese/thai, and/or breakfast and a general store, LCBO/beer store, pharmacy, and ice cream place. Some guests have seemed shocked that the cottage isn’t right downtown Ottawa with every city amenity imaginable, so I like to forewarn people in case you aren't familiar with the beauty that is Constance Bay.

There is a community centre with a children's and toddler's park a 5 minute drive away. There you will also find a skateboarding park, soccer fields, baseball diamonds, and outdoor rink in the winter.

There are 900 acres of protected forest area a stones throw away, perfect for hiking, biking, snowshoeing, cross-country skiing, snowmobiling, and ATVing.

description:
House located on Stonebridge golf course facing a beautiful parc. Quiet neighbourhood with families. Bus stop is in front of the house to go anywhere in Ottawa. By car it is approximately 30 min to drive downtown. Only 20 minutes from Airport. Due to covid 19 masks have to worn at all times entering the house and leaving the bedroom.

The space
It is 2 lovely bedrooms with shared bathroom. One bedroom has a Queen Size Bed and the other bedroom has one Double Bed. There is a TV with cable in one of the bedroom.

Guest access
There are 2 bedrooms available. You would be sharing the same bathroom with the other room. There would be a cost of $15 extra for the 4th person.

Other things to note
Enjoy your stay and feel at home!
neighborhood_overview: The house is located on the Golf Course in Stonebridge. It is a quiet area with families. There is a beautiful park behind the house with a playground and nice paths to go for a walk. Free private parking.

description:
Overlooking the Rideau Canal. A 20 minute walk to downtown, 15 minute walk to Lansdowne and an 8 minute walk to Elgin street. Near exits and entrances for highway 417 so not much city driving needed when coming to Ottawa. Professionally cleaned. Weekly and Monthly rates are available.

The space
The space is a 2 bedroom upper unit with its own entrance. With the Rideau Canal at the doorstep many year round activities can be done including; skating and biking. The Rideau Canal is Ottawas most defining feature aside from Parliament Hill. Within walking distance there is a Loblaws and LCBO. Many restaurants are in walking or short driving area including the By-Ward market, Elgin street and Lansdowne Live. Parliament Hill, Museums, National Arts Centre, Carleton U, UOttawa and the National Gallery of Canada are all close by. The unit includes a full kitchen with a stove, fridge, dishwasher, microwave and Keurig. There are windows are serve as excellent views to see th
neighborhood_overview: Many festivals occur on the rideau canal, including the worlds largest skating rink! Come for winterlude weekends or just casual skating.

description:
Unit w/outdoor space, downtown Ottawa! This 1bd unit has a Queen bed with high-end feathertop mattress and a well-appointed eat-in kitchen with coffee, condiments etc. Side deck/entrance gets most of the day's sun and is a great place to relax after exploring lively Chinatown, LittleItaly, and Lebreton Flats - all minutes away by foot! The unit is in the rear portion of our home, and you will enjoy complete privacy as our guest (unit available only when we are away). Tandem parking for 3 cars!

The space
This space is unique because you will have many of the benefits of renting an entire house (privacy and amenities), but because it is the rear segment only (rented while we are away and are not inhabiting the rest of the house), is priced as an apartment within a building.

Guest access
Everything within the space is yours to use - all kitchen appliances and supplies (since we live here most of the time you'll have more than the basics) telev
neighborhood_overview: The restaurants and shops in Chinatown and Little Italy are amazing! Ask us about access to nearby bike paths and the outdoor space at Dow's Lake! The Arboretum is also within walking distance, as well as Bank Street. We are two blocks west of Bronson, which connects directly to the Airport Parkway (10-15min drive)

description:
Welcome to Little Kyoto in Ottawa! Our home has a traditional Japanese-style tatami room where guests sleep on futon on the floor.

We and our fluffy, shy cat welcome guests to relax in Zen-inspired garden, enjoy many different types of tea throughout your visit, and enjoy our home gallery with traditional art and antiques. We are just 10 km from downtown Ottawa on major bus lines (17 min on one bus to downtown), just 10 min from the airport, offer free parking, kitchen and wifi. Welcome!

The space
Camellia House is a truly unique home which has been used for hosting events for the Embassy of Japan and featured on a number of TV, radio shows, and National Geographic over the 12 years we have lived here. Guests enjoy a relaxing, tranquil space - many called our home 'The Oasis House' and we do our best to welcome guests from all over the world throughout the year.

The guest room is a traditional 4.5 mat (yo-jo-han) tatami room where guests s
neighborhood_overview: Our street has 22 houses, all built in the 1960s and is a clean, safe, family neighbourhood just a 7 min walk to Mooney's Bay beach area. There is a small grocery store a short walk away and we are on all the main bus routes.

Easy commute by bus or OTrain to both universities, Parliament Hill and downtown, or by car to Gatineau and Highway 417. And with green spaces and recreational pathways at my doorstep, Walkscore rates my location a Walker's Paradise (91), Excellent Transit (88), Biker's Paradise (99).

A private sunny room with a very comfortable full-sized bed. Your bedroom is on the second floor (overlooking a quiet space) and next to the shared bathroom.
If your party would like more space, I have an additional quiet bedroom next to this one. Please book under separate listing.

description:
This beautiful piece of paradise situated on 10 acres boasts a small lake great for swimming and fishing in the summer and skating in the winter. Your view to the forest will likely include wild turkeys, deer, otters and birds galore. You will have a large room with a patio door and small private deck. Two very comfortable twin beds and your own large bathroom round out your accommodations. This relaxing country living is only 25 minutes from downtown Ottawa and 10 minutes to the CTC.

The space
If peace, serenity, nature and quality appeal to you, come to Driftwood. This beautiful bungalow has stone floors throughout and a bright open concept living, dining and kitchen area. A large southern facing deck with BBQ area has fabulous views of the lake. Your room is large with 2 very comfortable twin beds, a large closet, desk, patio doors opening to a small private deck looking out to the forest. A sparkling clean private bathroom is all yours.
neighborhood_overview: A beautiful neighborhood in the country.  25 minutes to downtown Ottawa.   Less than 15 minutes to the Canadian Tire Centre.  Close to the scenic town of Almonte which offers galleries, boutiques, antique shops and several first-class restaurants.

description:
Angela's B&B is a large old rambling family house located in central Ottawa on unceded Algonquin territory.
The room is a traditional room with a double bed and is located on the third floor. It has a private deck. Also open for guest use, there is a library-den and home office desk space on the third floor. All bathrooms are shared.
Accommodation includes unlimited organic fair-trade coffee and tea. If desired a full, mostly organic breakfast is available for $15.00.

The space
The Glebe House is a lively open-minded family household located in the centre of Ottawa on unceded Algonquin territory. We love to welcome guests who have interesting tales to tell and hold politically progressive and eco-friendly values. We have a large rambling old house with all amenities and a large backyard where we try to grow organic vegetables, BBQ and hold music, poetry and fund-raising shows.

This room is on the third floor (quiet) and has a double size bed.
neighborhood_overview:
Neighbourhood & Location: We are located in the Glebe, which is a central, treed, urban, thriving neighbourhood. Two blocks from the house you can find coffee shops, restaurants, grocery, pharmacy, boutiques, post office, wine bar, whatever.

One block from bus routes 1 & 7. Five minutes bus ride or 20 minutes walk to Parliament. Best way to get around Ottawa is by bike -- loaner bike + lock is available.

We are 5 minutes walk away from the Greyhound Bus Terminal and 15-20 minutes drive from the airport.

There is free overnight street parking, and we have a limited number of off-street parking spots (please reserve ahead of time).

description:
In the centre of downtown Ottawa, this beautifully kept heritage home on a quiet street is furnished to a high standard. All the best Ottawa has to offer is within walking distance; Parliament Hill, Little Italy, the Canal, Chinatown, museums, parks, the shops on Bank St. the Rideau Centre. You are minutes away from Ottawa's vast biking network. Great eateries nearby or pick up something healthy and scrumptious at the Red Apron on Gladstone.

The space
There is a spacious dining room & living room, a modern kitchen and bathroom and 2 good sized bedrooms, one with a small desk. The decor is modern (Natuzzi sofas) with a nod to the past (antique dressers). Enjoy the neighbourhood vibe from the front veranda or some outdoor privacy from the back deck. Mattresses are very high quality for your comfort. No pets please & no parties.

Guest access
Self checkin. The house is a duplex. The full main floor is the Airbnb and long-term tenants live
neighborhood_overview: While MacLeod St is a quiet neighbourhood, Gladstone St, which runs parallel, has some great food shops just minutes away.  The Red Apron, at 564 Gladstone has gourmet meals ready to go.  The Seed to Sausage General Store at 729 Gladstone make their own fantastic sausages.  True Loaf at 573 Gladstone Ave is awesome. Ayra Food at 508 Gladstone has a great variety of Persian food, including fresh pita. Also A wide variety of bars and nightlife. Just a short distance to the by-ward market. For seafood, Whalesbone at corner of Bank and Gladstone is tiny but wonderful.

description:
Centrally located in the golden triangle, this modest sized but cozy unit with a private entrance is hidden away at the rear of an old Victorian. Steps to the Canal and Elgin St with all its cafes and restaurants. A short walk / bike to downtown, parliament and the Byward Market. You can see the Canal from the front of the house! Bring your runners, roller blades or walking shoes. Fully equipped kitchen. Flowers by the private sitting area are in full bloom from spring into the summer.

The space
Private Patio space to relax in after a long day exploring. Full size Parking. Private entrance. Chemical sensitive -- Always cleaned with zero VOC all natural products except for only the most stubborn stains. Not that you'd have to so close to a plethora of amazing restaurants but if your passion is cooking you've found the right place with a fully stocked kitchen. Large windows on both sides of the living room allow for a comfortable cross breeze.
neighborhood_overview: Amazing.  Very quiet.   For running, biking, rollerblading or walking the Canal path links into the wider city system.  Loblaws and the LCBO are 2 blocks away as are many specialty shops on Elgin and a few more streets over - Bank St.  Police HQ on Elgin is one block away for those on Police business.   Canadian Musuem of Nature is 2 blocks away.  In 7 years I've been in the neighbourhood I've never had a safety or security problem.

description:
Welcome to "The Royal", a beautiful two bedroom charmer! A mix of high modern and historical features. Fully equipped and tastefully edgy. Lots of space and a private entrance.

We are happy to host short and long-term guests in this newly renovated, private unit in a heritage home. Located in the heart of Westboro beach. Five minute walk to shops, restaurants, pubs, transit bike paths and amenities in Westboro village. You'll love this home away from home!

description:
A new architecturally renovated 2-bedroom apartment located steps to Landsdowne Park (TD Place) and the Rideau Canal. This modern property combines urban conveniences with peaceful nature. With views of the Rideau River, this property is within walking distance to many shops, recreation facilities and restaurants. Inside you'll find a beautifully kept living space set with a full kitchen and enough space for 5 ppl. Family friendly with 'Brewer Park and Pool' a short walk away - you will love it!

The space
Architecturally designed open space with a zen + minimalist inspired concept. Access to all amenities.

Guest access
- Access to unlimited internet via wifi, two (2) 50" LCD / plasma display, an Apple TV, digital cable, Netflix, telephone and printer (via Airprint).

neighborhood_overview:
This upscale apartment is located right in the heart of one of Ottawa's busiest downtown neighbourhoods. Along Bank Street you'll find many unique shops, boutiques, restaurants and fun pubs.

We are also only about a few minute walk to Lansdowne Park which has a variety of different restaurants (Joey's, Locals, Milestones, Jack Astor's, etc...), movie theatre (Cineplex VIP), grocery stores (Whole Foods), a park and playground for children and TD Place. TD Place is home of our CFL team the Ottawa Redblacks (football), Ottawa Fury (soccer) and OHL 67's (hockey), as well as many concerts and events.

The Ottawa Rideau Canal is just down the street from the apartment, perfect for walking or running along. There is also a dock nearby where you can rent canoes + kayaks + paddle boats + city bicycles in the summer months.

description:
Private large 1 bedroom apartment situated downtown in a mature neighborhood. Private driveway and entrance, bright space, hardwood floors, wifi, Smart TV (+ movies, HBO), AC/Heat and heated floor, tempurpedic king size bed, new kitchen, private entrance to apartment with porch overlooking the garden. Bike path is directly situated in front of the home. Located within walking distance to the canal, museums, government buildings, shops, restaurants and grocery stores.

The space
The space is very roomy and bright and there are no stairs except for 2 steps to get on the porch. The interior of the home boasts a recently renovated modern gourmet kitchen with new appliances such as an induction stove with microwave and fan, dishwasher and large fridge with freezer, double sink, big island and bar area with a dining room table that sits up to six people. neighborhood_overview:
Centertown is a widely sought after location for tourists or professionals wanting to be close to everything the city of Ottawa has to offer.
Small businesses shops, restaurants, entertainment and Parliament Hill are all within walking distance. You will enjoy walking to the various shops and boutiques, the newly renovated Cadillac Fairview Rideau Shopping Center and the newly redesigned Lansdowne Park which includes the TD Place stadium are sure to meet all of your shopping needs. We are 10min walk away from Chinatown and 15min from Little Italy they are both popular areas for restaurants. Bank and Elgin St. have hip bars / restaurants / pubs.
There are a few museums located within walking distance such as the Museum of Nature, Museum of History, Museum of Agriculture, the National Gallery of Canada, etc. There are plenty of biking trails in Ottawa which can also take you to other areas such as the Gatineau Hills which are part of the Outaouais region.

description:
An artful oasis in the heart of Ottawa's Centretown neighbourhood.

The space
Relax in its open concept lounge, dine in the breakfast nook, pour yourself a glass of wine, put on a record, and dive into a coffee table book.

You are steps away from Centretown's adorable Dundonald Park, Chinatown, and a 12 minute walk to the Glebe, Golden Triangle. A 15-minute walk from Downtown, and the Hintonburg neighbourhoods.

The space
The apartment is located in a triplex house. It is an individual and private unit.

You will have full and private access to everything in the apartment, including the kitchen, living room, bedroom, and bathroom. The main entrance is located a few steps up from street level. The kitchen and living room are located on the ground floor; the bedroom and bathroom are located on the first floor. A narrow staircase leads from the living room directly into the bedroom.

neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a lively and hip neighbourhood. Special features that are just a few minutes away by foot from the apartment include:

1. Wellington Street: home to lots of restaurants and cute stores. A small grocery store is walking distance to the apartment. Large chain grocery stores are better reached by bike, bus, or car.

2. The Parkdale Market: this lively market is open daily from April to November, 6am to 6pm. You can find an array of fresh fruit, vegetables, and plants there.

3. Laroche Park: offers a large open field with two baseball diamonds, a children's play area, and an off-leash dog park.

4. Gatineau River Trail: you can enjoy a relaxing walk, run, bike ride, or (in the winter) cross-country skiing along the river. You can also use the trail for a scenic commute to downtown.

description:
Beautiful four season home on the Rideau River. Vacation in style in this stunning property that boasts a sweeping riverfront, and has spectacular views of the sunset.

Walking distance to The Swan on the Rideau restaurant and Hurst Marina. Short drive to restaurants in Osgoode and Manotick.

The space
This beautiful manor home has 6 bedrooms and 2.5 bathrooms. Huge eat in kitchen/living area and dining room. Property has a fire pit for smores and hot dogs and large deck with a barbecue for al fresco dining.

All bedrooms have fleecy sheets and new mattresses.
Master bedroom is huge with updated ensuite that has heated floors and towel rack.

Come enjoy nature by the water. Bring your boat and tie up at Hurst Marina, just a 2 minute walk away - there is no dock on our property. In winter bring your snowshoes or cross country skiis and enjoy the frozen river! Or, just bring a book and enjoy the peace and quiet!

The space

Guest access

neighborhood_overview:
From Wikipedia:

The Glebe is a neighbourhood in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. It is located just south of Ottawa's downtown area in the Capital Ward with its northern border being demarcated by the Queensway highway. It is bounded by the Rideau Canal to the south and east. Many maps show the western edge as Bronson Avenue, but some also include the triangle farther west formed by Bronson, Carling Avenue, and Dow's Lake. The Glebe Community Association uses the latter definition.[1] As of 2011, the area's population was 11,184.

The Glebe has a strong community association which, in addition to running a large community centre, lobbies the local government on issues such as traffic calming and neighbourhood development. The Glebe has a community newspaper, Glebe Report, that has been published independently since 1973.

The Glebe is mostly populated by families; the area has many children, and consequently its social services are oriented towards youth. The Gle

neighborhood_overview: This is one of the most prized neighbourhoods in Ottawa: friendly, easy going, with lots of amenities close by - Brewer Park with its great kids playgrounds, dog park, naturalised marshlands, splash pad, and in the winter hockey rinks and speed skating oval.   Brewer's newly renovated local pool - it's all jjust down the street. Carleton University is 1 km away and has an olympic pool and all a University has to offer. Downtown is a short 15 mn bus ride ( with the stop just 2 block from our house: close enough to be convenient, not so close as to be noisy), or better yet a 25 minute bike ride along UNESCO heritage designated Rideau Canal.   I regularly run to Parliament along the running and biking trails, the kids love to canoe there or on the Rideau River 1 block away from our house. description:
Our serene, modern, sun-filled 3-bedroom home is in the centre of the Glebe, just a few blocks from the Rideau canal and a 5-minute walk to trendy Bank Street, Lansdowne Park, theatres, and excellent nightlife. We’re also directly across the street from a small neighbourhood park with wonderful mature trees, soccer field, and children's playground.

The space
The house includes touches from our time living in Australia, Bali, Dubai, and India. Our well-stocked gourmet kitchen is a dream to cook in and enjoy family time in a beautiful space. The ground floor has ample space for relaxing and entertaining, and is drenched with natural light during the day (we’ve often been told that the space has a “zen” feel).

description:
Beautiful, spacious, newly decorated ground floor home located in the heart of the Byward Market on a quiet street. On sight free parking with a small back porch sitting area at the back of the home. Fantastic location, walking distance to all the sites & local amenities. This location can't be beat. Walk to the restaurants, bars, shops, Rideau Centre, Parliament Hill, NAC, The National Gallery, Museums & more. All new furnishings and freshly painted in May 2018. Long term stays are welcome.

The space
This listing is located on the ground level of a duplex. There is a second floor apartment as well. Both units have their own separate entrances and lots of privacy. These are not shared spaces. The main floor unit is quite spacious with three bedroom and a large dining and living room area. The kitchen is fully stocked with a dishwater, microwave, oven and washer and dryer. All listings have their own kitchenwear, linens and towels.

neighborhood_overview:
Join some friends for brunch, lunch or dinner, and then hit the shops for the highest quality food products, fashions and cutting edge trends. See and be seen until the wee hours at one of our hip nightspots. Morning, noon and night the ByWard Market has something just for you.

Established by Lt-Col. John By in 1826, the ByWard Market is one of Canada's oldest and largest public markets. The legendary builder of the Rideau Canal, Colonel By himself laid out the street plan of the Market, designating George Street and York Street to be extra wide to accommodate the creation of a public market and gathering place.

Within an area roughly four blocks square, you'll find museums, cafés, specialty food shops, boutiques, galleries, restaurants, pubs, hair & aesthetics salons and more! Easily accessible on foot, by transit or by car, the ByWard Market offers a unique experience for all.

description:
Quiet house in Ottawa, Ontario (3 rooms: 1 with a Queen bed, and 2 with full beds). It accommodates 6 adults comfortably.

Giovanna is living at the house. 3/4 bedrooms are available (including the Master bedroom). At the moment, I offer shared accommodations only.

Manotick is a picturesque community located on the Rideau River in the rural portion of the City of Ottawa, 30 min from downtown. The house is located in the Manotick Island.

The space
Manotick is the perfect place for a relaxing stay, with great hiking and biking trails.
Easy and city maintained access to the river, for kayaks, canoes and fishing boats.

The house is very quiet and private, a great place to stay both in summer and winter times. It is located in an island on the Rideau with a direct view of the River without the noise that the waterfront homes suffer.

Guest access
Shared accommodations, ranging from one, two or three bedrooms.
neighborhood_overview:
The Manotick Long Island is an old and family oriented community, with large lots and very private houses. It is a perfect place for kids because it is extremely safe.

Walking 15-20 minutes, the Manotick Village is a historical site, founded in 1859, before Canada existed as a unified country. At the village, one can visit the Watson's Mill, an unique 1860's grist and flour mill, with close relations with historical local politics, and the building of the Confederation.

Kayaks and canoes can be carried to the Rideau public access places, without a need for a car ride. This allows kids that are comfortable paddling, to freely come and go from the house to the river.

The Manotick Island has only 3 car access points, which makes it one of the safest places in Canada.

neighborhood_overview:
Our home is centrally located with easy access to Parliament Hill, Art Galleries, museums, National Arts Centre, TD Place or other recreational activities.
The place is within walking distance to the Mooney's Bay park and Rideau canal. The canal is a UNESCO site. Ottawa's famous Tulip Festival is in May and there are many music festivals throughout the 3 warmer seasons. Ottawa Blues Fest is in 10 min drive.
There are a multitude of ethnic festivals close-by: the Greek Festival in mid August, the Ukrainian festival and the Serbian festival are all in 5 min drive. The Lebanese festival in walking distance.
Bike or walk along the canal or nearby paths. You can travel the whole city by cycling on the integrated cycling routes.
Across the Ottawa river, only 20 minutes by car is Gatineau Park for challenging cycling and hiking.
Just enjoy all that Ottawa has to offer. It is a wonderful, vibrant city to visit.

neighborhood_overview:
You are located seconds away from the canal where you can hop on a bike or walking path for a scenic route to Museums, Lansdowne, The Byward Market, The Glebe, Preston street, Tulip festival, Winterlude and much more.

Parliament Hill and the Byward Market is about a 25 minute walk/5 min drive or ten min bike ride away.

Join some friends for brunch, lunch or dinner, and then hit the shops for the highest quality food products, fashions and cutting edge trends. See and be seen until the wee hours at one of our hip nightspots.
Morning, noon and night the ByWard Market has something just for you.

Established by Lt-Col. John By in 1826, the ByWard Market is one of Canada's oldest and largest public markets. The legendary builder of the Rideau Canal, Colonel By himself laid out the street plan of the Market, designating George Street and York Street to be extra wide to accommodate the creation of a public market and gathering place.

description:
You will feel right at home in this delightful & quiet studio apartment steps away from cafes, restaurants, bars, live music & theater, boutiques, take-out food & groceries. In the heart of trendy Hintonburg, and close to downtown Ottawa.

Immaculately renovated, this ground floor apartment is tastefully decorated and stocked with thoughtful comforts to ensure an outstanding experience! Clean & Green: we use environmentally friendly cleaning products. SEE BELOW - PROTECTION DURING COVID-19.

The space
A squeaky clean, bright studio with a comfy dining and living space, kitchenette and 3-piece en suite bathroom. Furnished with character, comfort, and quality. A striking chaise lounge to relax on, a handsome desk to work at, and everything you need for a great night's sleep with a super comfortable queen size bed and black-out curtains.

PRECAUTIONS WE ARE TAKING DURING THE CORONAVIRUS OUTBREAK: In order to protect our guests (and ourselves)
neighborhood_overview:
Hintonburg is a safe and friendly neighbourhood – and the trendiest place in town. Within a few blocks you will find a selection of cafés, restaurants, pubs, microbreweries, live music and theatre. If you like to stay fit you will appreciate the nearby yoga studio, fitness studios and city-run gym and pool. Close by are parks, bike trails and cross-country skiing. You could learn to sew, knit, do pottery or blow glass nearby. In fact, you could enjoy an action- packed vacation and never leave the neighbourhood! Guests feel like instant locals and we provide all the information you need to do so.

There is plenty of choice in restaurants and cafes nearby for all budgets. If you are eating in, you will find grocery stores at the top of the street, including the Hintonburg Marché providing deli meat & cheese, local produce and healthy take out prepared meals; Bread by Us for fresh baked bread & pastries. The LCBO down the street provides wine, beer and spirits.

neighborhood_overview: Sandy Hill is a quiet neighbourhood located downtown. The neighbourhood is bordered on the west by the Rideau Canal and on the east by the Rideau River. It has some of the oldest buildings in Ottawa, illustrating the quirky building style of the past few centuries in the Capital. There are coffee shops, restaurants and shops all within 5-10 minutes walk and the famous Byward Market, filled with fine dining and night life, is a 10-15 minute walk. Also within walking distance is University of Ottawa, Parliament Hill, Elgin street, many Embassy's and other historical landmarks.

description:
A beach style chalet, I Love Your House is an open concept single family home, very bright, with a big backyard, located in the heart of Center town Ottawa. Built in the 1800s, it's been totally renovated, yet maintains the charm of an old log home.

The space
A perfect house to accommodate a couple, two couples, or a family while visiting Ottawa, the nation's capital. 'I Love Your House' features an open concept design, with a split-level living and kitchen area, plus 1/2 bath, on the ground floor, and two bedrooms plus a main bathroom on the split-level second floor. The large master bedroom has a queen-size bed, Smart TV, plenty of closet space, and backyard-facing balcony. The second bedroom has a double bed, a beautiful armoire, and a balcony that faces the street. There is a huge, new deck, with a covered porch and bbq in the back yard, plus room to park two cars. Lots of windows throughout and very bright. It's a very clean, happy and warm environment,

neighborhood_overview:
Wellington West is an artsy, historic neighbourhood in the heart of Ottawa. The neighbourhood is home to a huge number of acclaimed restaurants (over 88 according to Urban Spoon) including Supply and Demand, voted Canada's 4th best restaurant by enRoute magazine last year and Soca Kitchen and Pub, great article in Porter Airlines magazine recently.

This fun neighbourhood is changing and growing up, so you'll find traditional diners and an "old school" bowling lane cozying up to several gourmet restaurants, a microbrewery, SuzyQ gourmet donuts...(heaven sent!) independent cafes, bars and local designers' shops. You can stroll through Wellington West or Hintonburg on your way to Westboro, Little Italy, Chinatown, or down to the scenic Ottawa Parkway and Ottawa river bike/walking path.

neighborhood_overview: Located on a quiet residential street, only a few houses away from Wellington Street West, right in the heart of Wellington West Village, one of the city's most charming neighbourhoods. It's a true village, with a classic main street just steps away (literally a 1 minute walk). Walk to all the amenities you could ask for in 1-5 minutes, including several grocery stores, pharmacies, and bike shops, countless cafés & bakeries, a wide variety of excellent restaurants (fine dining, casual, and fast food), many great bars, 2 liquor stores, and a beer store. You'll find gems like the specialty Italian deli/grocer, our neighbourhood hardware store, an ice cream shop, a gelato bar, and more. This home is located in the Byward Market area, true urban downtown location close to pubs, restaurants, museums and amenities (LCBO, grocery stores, boutiques, Bridgehead coffee shop, etc). There is a hair dryer in the bathroom and an iron and ironing board in the bedroom. It is a basement unit, but well lit, with a large window facing the pool. There is also a ping pong table for a game - or to spread out your travel gear. We also have central A/C.

Guest access

description:

neighborhood_overview:
Steps from Elgin St with its hip and chic hotspots to have drinks, dinner and enjoy the nightlife!
Minutes from the Rideau Canal for ice skating in winter and beautiful strolls in summer.
Minutes from the Canadian Museum of Nature, and a walking distance to Parliament Hill, Rideau Center, National Arts Centre and the Byward Market. Minutes from the University of Ottawa.
Quiet neighborhood with parks and kids play areas, yet right in the heart of the Golden Triangle. Take a walk along Elgin St to enjoy a coffee, freshly baked croissants or a pint from the local pub.

description:
Angela's B&B is a large old rambling family house located in central Ottawa on unceded Algonquin territory.
The family suite is on the second floor with a queen bed in the front room and a bunk bed in the attached back room. It is possible to add a baby crib as well. All bathrooms are shared.
Accommodation includes unlimited organic fair-trade coffee and tea. If desired a full, mostly organic breakfast is available for $15.00/person, $6.00 kids 6-12yrs, under 6 free.

The space
We love to welcome guests into our home who have interesting tales to tell and hold politically progressive and eco-friendly values. We believe that a better world is possible. We strive to live with a lower carbon and environmental footprint.

Angela’s place is located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.
Angela’s Bed & Breakfast is located in the Glebe, which is a central, treed, urban, thriving neighbourhood. Two blocks from the house you can find coffee shops, restaurants, grocery, pharmacy, boutiques, post office, wine bar, cinema, hardware store… whatever.

description:
My place is 3 km from downtown - an average of 10 minutes away by car, and 15 minutes by bus. It is conveniently located for central destinations such as the Byward Market, national museums, National Gallery, National Arts Centre, Parliament Hill, and Rideau Canal, and many amenities such as recreational pathways, main streets, supermarkets, etc., and to venues for many of Ottawa's 33 festivals, including Winterlude, Tulip Festival, and the Blues Fest.

The space
The apartment has been recently renovated and it is very clean and cheerful. It is two-storey with a bedroom and bathroom upstairs, and a combined living room and kitchen on the ground floor. The front door is on the east side of the house, and the back door opens onto a nice private deck surrounded by greenery, which is for guests only.

My street is a quiet one with a cul-de-sac to the east and a one-way street for west-bound traffic ending at a small residential junction at its western end.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is a well-established French Canadian part of Ottawa. Rockcliffe and the Ottawa River are a short distance to the north and the Rideau River is just to the west. There is a lovely pathway along the east side of the Rideau River which runs for 10 km south to the Hog's Back Falls Park and 3 km north to where the Rideau River drops over a 9-metre cliff into the Ottawa River. There are some good views of Downtown Ottawa from the falls. 13 minutes' walk to the north of my home is Richelieu Park, which is home to urban Ottawa's last surviving sugar bush where over 1,000 maple trees are tapped. It's the only urban sugar bush in North America. The dates for the Maple Sugar Fest at the the Vanier Sugar Shack can be found on at www.ottawa.ca or by phoning 613 580-2440.

neighborhood_overview:
The Glebe is a very desirable trendy neighbourhood with big trees and lovely old brick homes. There is quick easy access to all that Ottawa offers. If you are visiting as a tourist, it's a great way to experience a real neighbourhood with interesting old and new architecture, and safe residential streets, just one neighbourhood out from the downtown core.
The new Lansdowne complex is minutes away. It has the sports stadium, a Cineplex movie theatre, two condo towers, shops including a Whole Foods Market, a park, and an outdoor concert area.
The World Heritage Site canal, with its bike/jogging/walking paths and green spaces, surrounds the neighbourhood on three sides. I'm a few minutes walk from the canal.
The neighbourhood has a lively mix of residents including university students, seniors, families, and professional singles. People come from all over the city on the weekends to enjoy the pedestrian environment and events at Lansdowne.
You can also walk to Dow's

description:
Watch beautiful sunsets over the Ottawa River from a spacious balcony, comfy living room, elevated dining room, open kitchen or cozy bedrooms of this 20th floor condo!

Enjoy biking along the Ottawa River bike paths! Bike to Parliament, Byward Market, Museums or work at Health Canada in Tunney's Pasture.
Delight yourself with Sunday Brunch in Westboro or picnic at Britannia Beach!

This classy condo has a fine Gym, Squash Court, steamy Sauna and super Swimming Pool and so much more!

The space
Great space with a breath-taking view of town, hills and river. My 15th-floor condo has a wonderful layout: Upon entering the bathroom is to the left, the bedroom straight ahead, the dining-living-office corner slightly to the right and kitchen more to the right, with a dish pass-thru between the kitchen and dining! Cozy leather triple and single seating in the living-room. Also leather dining room chairs! Very comfy & stylish!
neighborhood_overview:
Neighbourhood has a very convenient major Loblaws grocery store across the street! A great pizza & bowling place across the other street! Above all, a very green area of town with a path for walkers, joggers and cyclists just a few streets away. It’s along the Rideau River, so very green, plenty of trees, geese, ducks and other birds. If you’re lucky you’ll see a beaver or further up the river, swans!! A beautiful oasis of nature, just a few minutes away from this beautiful 15th-floor home!

There are also plenty of indoor and outdoor tennis courts, nearby, also along Rideau River!

You are about a 20-minute walk to downtown Ottawa or to University of Ottawa Campus.

We are located in the Glebe, a fabulous central Ottawa neighbourhood!

This guest room is located in a main floor apartment within an elegant Victorian home in the heart of the Glebe neighbourhood of Ottawa.

It has a comfortable double bed, small desk with good lighting, and clothes storage unit as well as a hanger on the back of the door. There are ample linens, and as well a portable heater or fan to adjust the temperature to your comfort level.
The room is at the front of the home, facing the street, and has sunlight throughout the day. There are blinds to block out light and provide privacy.

Female tenants ONLY!

The othe
neighborhood_overview:
This is my favourite Ottawa neighbourhood! It's walkable, within walking distance to the nearby neighbourhoods of Centretown, Chinatown, Old Ottawa South and Main Street. The Glebe has a mixed population with many students, as it is located equidistant to Carleton, University of Ottawa, and U. St. Paul. It is boundaried by the Rideau Canal on the East, the 417 to the North, Bronson Avenue to the West, and Sunnyside Avenue to the South.
There are numerous cafes, bakeries and ice cream shops, grocers, restaurants, a florist, a Home Hardware, two pharmacies, a public library, lots of health care resources, and within a 15 minute walk the Landsdowne Park Development has a movie theatre, farmer's market, Whole Foods, and many other specialty shops.
The neighbourhood also has lots of green space, and is home to Central Park that hosts annual art, music and theatre productions including "Shakespeare in the Park".

neighborhood_overview:
Mooney's Bay Park- 17 acres of land is 2 1/2 blocks north of Airbnb. Readily accessible biking paths in all directions for exploring the City. At the closest intersection, Revelstoke Drive, there are many prestigious homes abuting the waterfront of Mooney's Bay.

In the proximity, you have Billings Bridge- huge mall. Also 5 blocks north, is the Bank of Nova Scotia; Riverside Beauty Salon; i Cook Persian Cuisine. 3 Street lights south, walking distance to popular Riverside Pub (always busy, home cooked meals). 2 Tim Hortons - one at Hogs Back; other on Hunt Club - 1 1/2 blocks East of T & T.

Close to T & T Supermarket, RA Centre, EY Centre and Lansdowne Centre (sports, cinemas & Whole Foods). Lansdowne Park is approx. 20 mins. by car and is the home of Ottawa Red Blacks hockey team and many other events.

Skating on the Rideau Canal (recognized by UNESCO World Heritage) is great for an invigorating session. Boating, bicycling or hiking is available.

description:
Warm & inviting, newly renovated Art-Deco style, 3-storey/3 bedroom older home, located in Ottawa's vibrant, hip Hintonburg neighbourhood. Betwixt the Experimental Farm and Wellington St. & 3km from downtown Ottawa & Parliament Buildings.

The space
Family-friendly 'Fairmont House' is the perfect space to accommodate three generations on their family vacation to Ottawa, the nation's capital. Three bedrooms, two with Queen-sized beds, one with a double bed and two full bathrooms....What better way for Mom & Dad, the two kids and grandparents to enjoy their own private house, minutes from parks, the Experimental Farm (with arboretum and the Agriculture Museum) Dow's Lake, bike paths and the coolest neighbourhood in Canada? All the basics and only 2km from the Museum of History (formerly Museum of Civilization, with its Kids' Museum), the War Museum and 3km from the Parliament buildings. Come to Canada Day celebrations in July (with free bus service) or the Jazz Fest
neighborhood_overview: This is a spectacular Ottawa location if you're a walker or cyclist. If you love to walk &/or cycle during your stay, this is the Ottawa neighbourhood for you! Restaurants, cool boutiques are a five minute stroll away. This location is also Ottawa's theatre district, with close by pubs, community events, music and readings. It is only a 10 minute cycle from the stunning Ottawa River Parkway bike paths in one direction and a five minute walk from the Experimental Farm, with its beautiful gardens, in the other. You're a 20 minute bus ride or O-Train ride (great service, by the way) or a 40 minute walk to the Parliament buildings, the National Art Gallery, many museums and live concert sites in the summer. In winter, you're a 15 minute walk from Dow's Lake and the Rideau canal, the World Heritage site of Canada's longest skating rink (8Km)! You're also only a 15 minute drive from the amazing Gatineau Parkway (on the Quebec side) which is host to the most colourful display of autumn colour

description:

Full well stocked kitchen has a dishwasher, 3rd bedroom has 2 single beds. Parking included. House is in a modest area with many amenities nearby. Enjoy over 50 paintings by canadian artist Gisèle Lapalme throughout the house. Ever lived in an art gallery? Come live this unique experience in Canada's capital! Kids? Safety gates, crib, toys and more provided.

The space
Newly renovate, this spacious 960 square feet home has an updated decor for a cozy and relaxing get-away. Very sunny throughout, west-facing with views of lovely sunsets. Located on the outskirt of a modest neighbourhood. Kitchen fully stocked and well equiped for the chef in you. Many restaurants (indian, pho, jamaican, chinese, The Works, Swiss Chalet, McDonalds, Tim Horton's), groceries, pharmacies, beer and LCBO close by. Enjoy the unique canadian art work on d
neighborhood_overview: Unique grotto of Lourdes situated in front of the house. This is a large park with mature trees used as an outdoor church during the summer. Lovely bakery and café 2 blocs away that offers fresh baked goods. Canada's National Cemetary is a short walk away and one of the many sites to see while in Ottawa. My neighbourhood is modest and the townhouse project was built in the 70s. It is a private property on a cul de sac with mature trees and well groomed yards surrounded by cedar hedges. The grotto and the project's many mature trees add to the quality of this modest townhouse project. Montreal Road is very close by offering easy access to regular buses to downtown (12 min ride).

description:
This classic brick home, located in the heart of the trendy Glebe neighbourhood, is a short walk from shops, boutiques and restaurants that line one of Ottawa's most iconic streets. Venture 5 minutes down the street to Landsdowne's TD Place to take in a sporting event, enjoy a Kettleman's bagel, or visit the Rideau Canal, there are no shortages of things to do in this neighbourhood. Visit this iconic neighbourhood and stay in this 2 bed, 1 bath home away from home.

The space

This Airbnb has a fully functional kitchen on the main floor for our guests to enjoy cooking homemade meals. The cozy living room off the main entrance has a pull-out bed for extra guests. The space
The yurt is heated by a wood stove which you can also use to heat up / cook light meals and make tea/coffee. There is water for drinking and hand washing provided , otherwise it is off grid.

You can access the surrounding forest, all trails and the out house. Snow shoes provided for guests.

The property was the site of a UFO sighting in 1992 and featured on Unsolved Mysteries.

I offer private / small group yoga classes in the yurt - rate depends on number of people attending.

Aerial yoga in treehouse

description:
Welcome to your home away from home in the Glebe! This newly renovated space is on a quiet, residential street in the heart of the Glebe. A short walk to Bank Street restaurants & shops, Lansdowne Park, the Rideau Canal, and Dow's Lake. Near hospitals, downtown, the Parliament Buildings, and the Byward Market. This spacious, fully-equipped, 2-bedroom apartment will be the ideal place for your short or long-term stay in Ottawa. The apartment has a separate entrance and parking for one car.

Other things to note
Please note this is a basement apartment and we live upstairs. We have two small children. You may hear busy footsteps in the daytime.
Internet is provided and there is a smart tv which you can use your Netflix account on.
neighborhood_overview:
The stretch of Bank Street that runs through the Glebe is one of Ottawa's premier shopping areas, with many small stores and restaurants offering a wide variety of services.
The Glebe is home to Lansdowne Park which contains TD Place Stadium, where Ottawa's Canadian Football League (CFL) football team (the Ottawa Redblacks) and the University of Ottawa Gee-Gees play their home games. Lansdowne Park also contains TD Place Arena, which is the permanent home of the Ottawa 67's and was the temporary home (1992–1995) for the Ottawa Senators before the Canadian Tire Centre (originally called The Palladium) was completed. The area that became the park was purchased from local farmers in 1868 by the City of Ottawa Agricultural Society.

From the canal two bodies of water jut into the Glebe: Patterson Creek and Brown's Inlet. These areas are surrounded by parks and some of the city's most expensive homes.

description:
The apartment is near restaurants, family-friendly activities, nightlife, parks and two different shopping centres.

It's cozy, quiet and fully furnished with all the essentials. It's ideal for couples, business travellers and small families. We put information on the bus schedules, activities happening in Ottawa and maps at your disposal.

We make it our mission to welcome all of our guest with a small token of our appreciation and stay available for them through the whole booking.

The space
Welcome to our one bedroom apartment in the heart of Downtown Ottawa. It is small, cozy and a short walk to parks, grocery stores, touristic attractions and bus routes. We also include various amenities like parking, internet and condiments, snacks, coffee/tea and toiletries.

The apartment is located in a safe and quiet neighbourhood. 10-15 minutes walk from downtown, all Ottawa's main attractions are available to you by taking a quick bus

description:
My place is close to Westgate and Carlingwood Malls. Short drive to trendy Westboro Village, several parks in the neighbourhood. Close proximity to 3 Hospitals, restaurants and cafés. You’ll love my place because it's Centrally located in a quite neighbourhood, with quick access to the Queensway and only 7-10 minutes from downtown. My place is good for couples, business travellers, families (with kids), and big groups. Very clean and fresh!

The space
Large 3 bedroom apartment unit within a small six unit building. Functional and clean layout on one floor, gleaming hardwood floors, brand new kitchen and bathroom.

Guest access
Guests can use front or back doors with same access codes

Other things to note
You can use both front and back doors! Same codes

description:
-Condo located 5 min to main transit
-10 min bike ride to Westboro & beaches
-15 minute drive to downtown along the Parkway
-Private path on to NCC bike paths along the Ottawa River
-Large balcony
-Pool/gym/Sauna

*Please send the request with the FULL amount of time you require for a stay.

The space
Large private balcony, sunken style living room, WiFi and net flix, full kitchen, shared bathroom (with 1 person). Stand up lamp with wireless cell phone charging, alarm clock with USB charger and Bluetooth speaker and full closet.

Guest access
Access to whole condo except master bedroom. Access to the kitchen, provided you follow all rules stated. Access to a private path to NCC bike paths/the Ottawa river.

Nice neighbourhood with tons of green space. Walking distance to bike paths that go all the way from Kanata through downtown and to Québec. Also walking distance to Mud lake hiking trail, which has pond skating in the winter and is known for its bird watching.

*Please Note Amenities are currently closed due to COVID-19. Earliest availability is Sept. 1st it is my hope that amenities will be open again by then

description:
Large and very private sun-filled 1-bedroom lower unit in a popular residential area and right on major bus lines for easy access to downtown. Tastefully decorated with an authentic African theme.

Great views and access to a lovely backyard with sun deck, lawn, and flowering gardens.

Lots of living space including separate living/dining/sunroom and kitchen/living room with very large sofa (with pull-out double bed).

Walking distance to Algonquin College, College Square, and Merivale Road.

Other things to note
Please note that we welcome well-behaved pets (and their owners :))!
